results.description:
Before the RSVP deadline passes, I wanted to provide the details for the Scavenger Hunt.
Teams will meet at Chelsea Barcade at noon (they open at noon, so we might not get in until shortly after noon).  We will provide last-minute details and then start the clock by 12:30.  All teams must return to Barcade by 4:00 to tally the points.
The hunt will consist of three parts.  The first is a set of  over 100 location-specific clues.  Your team must figure out the location, get to it, and take a picture of your team at/in/in front of the location.
The second part is 50 "goals' that are not location specific -- you should get a photo if you see one.  Like the location-specific clues, your team must be in every picture.
The third part is a challenge round.  It will require the teams to get to a specific location within a specific timeframe and perform a challenge.  Details of the challenge will not be disclosed until the noon orientation at Barcade.
There will be penalties for teams getting back to Barcade after 4:00.  They will be deducted 1 point per minute until 4:05.  They will then be deducted 5 points per minute until 4:10, and then ten points per minute after that.
This hunt was designed so that it would be next to impossible to get pictures of every clue and goal within the allotted time.  Instead, it is all about points.
A few more rules:(1) Selfie sticks are prohibited, unless a clue specifically calls for one.(2) Teams may not use any motorized transportation to get around except pubic transit -- i.e., buses and subways only.  Teams caught using cabs, limos, livery cars, Uber, Lift or the like will be disqualified.
I will post a final team list once the RSVP window closes.
results.name: Let's Have a Scavenger Hunt and then Drink Beer

results.description:
Atheist Legend Ellen Johnson to Tell 

                                How Atheists Can Win the Politics Game


 The Former AA Prez Will Disclose, At NYCA Sunday Brunch, 


  October 11, How We Can Get Politicians to Pay Attention to Us

-------------------------------

The Democrats have Hillary, the Republicans have Carly, the Germans have Angela Merkel--and we Atheists have Ellen Johnson. 

Who is Ellen Johnson?  If you don’t know who Ellen Johnson is, then you have missed out on a salient piece of Atheist history.  Ellen was the protégée of American Atheist Inc. (AA) founder Madalyn Murray O’Hair, who was murdered in 1995.  After O’Hair and her family went missing that year, Ellen Johnson kept AA going for what in the end totaled 13 years.


The bodies of  Madalyn Murray O’Hair, her son and her granddaughter were found in 2001, buried on a remote Texas ranch. One of  the family’s murderers, an ex-convict named David Waters, led police to the burial site. 

Johnson Kept AA Alive


Ellen Johnson and other leaders of AA were devastated by the crime and the loss of the O’Hairs.  Ellen moved the AA headquarters from Austin, TX to Cranford, NJ, where she established an AA base in a warehouse and housed the rare and priceless Atheist book collection of the O’Hairs.  As president of AA, the strikingly attractive Ellen Johnson represented us on TV, radio and all media--including Larry King Live, Good Morning America, Fox News and MSNBC, to mention but a few--bringing to Atheism a youthful dignity and wisdom.


And then suddenly, her tenure in AA was over in a heated discord with her Board of Directors as Ellen persisted in honoring her beloved mentor, O’Hair, by conducting a freedom march through the Southern states of the U.S. 


Founded New Political Group


After leaving the presidency of AA, Ellen went on to to establish and lead the Atheist organization “Enlighten the Vote,” dedicated to supporting Atheist candidates for public office and to advancing the Atheist cause through political and legislative means.


Like the proverbial phoenix, Ellen Johnson rose from the ashes of her AA presidency (and really, isn’t 13 years enough?) to head what is probably the most important route for Atheists to take in order to gain our rightful place in the USA.


And that, friends, is why our legendary, outspoken Ellen Johnson, one of the early mainstays of the Atheist movement, is speaking to us at our Brunch on October 11, on how we can advance our cause by winning political power.


We’re Ignored by Politicians!


“Are you tired of being ignored by politicians whom you keep in office with your votes?” Ellen Johnson asks us.


“You have the power and ability to have politicians court your votes!” she insists. ”We can do this by rethinking the way to political power, because the old ways simply don’t work.”


What will work?  Come hear Ellen Johnson on October 11 tell us what we can do to obtain our rightful place in the democracy that we are supporting with our tax money!


Courageous Leader 


Come hear the forthright, candid, gutsy lady who has had the courage to stand up to the world, the media and even her board of directors, and who is now telling us how to stand up to our politicians.


Come and let us pay our respects to the heroes (and heroines) who fought the Atheist battle when it was not yet all that fashionable. Let us appreciate those who gave everything--even their lives in some cases--for our secular cause.

Most important of all, let us listen to the experience-earned wisdom of icons like Ellen Johnson who have learned the hard way what we must do to advance our cause.  


------------------------------

EVENT SUMMARY


WHAT:        “How Atheists Can Win the Politics Game” a talk by Ellen Johnson 


former president of American Atheists Inc. and currently head of 

 “Enlighten the Vote,” an organization to help more Atheists run for 

office.

WHEN:         SUNDAY, October 11,  at 12 p.m.


WHERE:       THE PRESS BOX (2nd Floor) 932 Second Ave.  (Bet. 49th & 50th Streets.


COST:            Brunch is $20, including buffet entrees, salad, soft drink, coffee tax and tip.  We encourage seconds!

================================

This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 12pm-3pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
******Please note: Due to the overwhelming response for our Indian Brunch event, this has been moved to a larger restaurant to accommodate everyone! The new location is Brick Lane Curry House, 99 Second Ave. We will be occupying the entire back area.

Namaste; fall weather is upon us, but fret not, let's warm up with upscale Indian fare from Brick Lane on the Lower East Side.  

Brick Lane offers an all-you-can-eat lunch buffet featuring Desi staples, like Tandoori Chicken, Saag Paneer, Naan, Chicken Tikka Masala and more.


The cost will be about $15 + tax and tip. Please bring cash only, NO exceptions. All drinks will be paid for separately. The meetup fee is waived for this event.

Brick Lane is well-reviewed on Yelp. Excerpts include:


"The buffet options are great and they even have some fresh lettuce and veggies to make a little salad. The food is super flavorful and served at the right temperature. Naan and water wait for you at your table while you make multiple trips to try everything! The staff is nice and keep track of clearing your plates in a pretty quick fashion. The biryani has huge pieces of chicken in it and the fish curry is a Nice light option. The food isn't crazy spicy so if you need more a kick they can give you some hot sauce! Great lunch option and will be back when our Indian food hankering kicks in!"

"I was the first person here for this All-you-can-eat Indian Buffet, which was only $13 including tax. It included Salad, Cauliflower, Soup, Rice, Roti, 5 Hot dishes, Masala Chai Tea, Dessert, soda, beer, and/or sangria. Everything looked fresh, smelled great, and tasted delicious. I had a beer-mosa.  They give you Roti, a large water bottle, and a Tandoori chicken leg to start. The Pakoras were deep fried in chick pea battered.  These little vegetable fritters were absolutely wonderful.  The rice was soft. I stole all of the peas and carrots.  Here are my guesses on what I think I ate:

-Aloo Gobi contained soft potatoes and lentils stew.

-Peeli Daal contained yellow lentils flavored with

 garlic and herbs.

-Tofu Jalfrezi  contained spiced tomato curry with stir-fried onions, bell peppers and tomatoes. 

-Chicken Goan contained a mix of green chilies, coconut, coriander and vinegar.

-Tikka Masala or Chicken Tandoori had a very thick tomato cream sauce

Everything was quite good.  The Chicken Goan came on the bone which made it hard to eat.  The Chicken Tikka was cut into large chunks, tender, and plentiful.  I basically had three plates of this chicken with Rice and Flatbeard.

For Dessert they had Gulab Jamun which is a lightly fried Milk Protein Dough and topped with simple syurp.  The texture was weird but enjoyable,

The service was not bad but not spectacular because its a lunch buffet.

Next Time: the Spicy: Man v Food Phaal challenge"
results.name: Sunday Brunch: Indian Buffet at Brick Lane (New Venue)

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society Presents:

"Sexy Halloween Shoot w/Neesy & Stephanie - Oct. 11th"

Halloween season is here and we had such a great time on last month's "dress up" shoots that we're back with the first Halloween shoot for this month. We're bringing back the incredible Neesy Rizzo and the beautiful Stephanie Dec, both reliable and fun models who always gives us awesome shots. 

About the Shoot:

We're keeping with the glamour twist on the Halloween theme for these shoots. The models will be going for a more costume feel and theme and we'll try out a few lighting schemes, like high key, natural light, dramatic lighting and low key. We'll even bring out the smoke machine for this one! 

For new members: Please take the time to read the info below about how the Meetup is organized and how the shooting parameters are setup.

Cost: $80

(Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge)

(Non-Commercial Release provided onsite or PDF version to email registered upon check-in.)

Models:

Neesy Rizzo: Instagram and Facebook

(PhotoCredits: NandoPro)

(Photo Credits: Photodepotbyjoe)


Stephanie Dec: MM#[masked]

(Photos provided by model for promotional purposes only. All rights their respective owners.)

One-on-Ones: The models will be available for half hour one on one shoots after the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

NEW Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

____________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

We will keep the group small although we have the space to accommodate a big group. This keeps things from feeling rushed and overwhelming. Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. So, at the very least give us 3 days notice that you will not be able to attend or in case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up past the 3 days notice, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup.

Waitlist - When you are on a wait list, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels within the 3 days before the shoot, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes". Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please email me at [masked]
results.name: Sexy Halloween Shoot w/Neesy & Stephanie - Oct. 11th

A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.

results.description:
7th ANNUAL SHSNY FREETHOUGHT DAY BRUNCH, LECTURE AND CONVERSATION

Massimo Pigliucci is a Professor of Philosophy at CUNY-City College, editor in chief of the online magazine Scientia Salon, prolific author, and Honorary Member of SHSNY who has lately turned his attention to the ancient Greco-Roman philosophy of ethics and resilience that is Stoicism. He says: 

“Stoicism is experiencing a surprising comeback these days, positioning itself as the Western answer to Buddhism, with which it shares a number of similarities. In this talk I will explain the basics of Stoicism and argue that it is a philosophy highly suitable to the complexities of life in the 21st century, perhaps even a good complement to secular humanism.”

Join us! Brunch is $25 ... for your choice of 11 excellent entrees, one drink (Bloody Mary, Mimosa, etc.) and coffee or tea, and including all taxes and tips.

Pre-pay now at shsny.org ... to reserve your place, because the room at Pete’s only seats 50.

Questions? email [masked] ... or call[masked], and leave a call-back number.
results.name: SHSNY Freethought Day Brunch! Massimo Pigliucci! "Stoicism Today!"

results.description:
Updated October 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

FALL (Sep - Nov)

As the city cools down we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park on weekdays and Morningside Park for weekends.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th & Manhattan Ave) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Morningside Park (110th & Manhattan Ave) 
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End) 
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

Damien 
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).
results.why: It's fun and you like it...

results.description:
Ok, let’s be honest: l-o-v-e can be complicated.  Your hand is tired from swiping R/L and more often than not, relationships are built over text. As mindful women, dating in NYC can leave us feeling….ehh..let’s just say a bit spooked. For those of us in relationships, it is easy to feel disconnected from our partners.


So—this got me thinking: how can WE be the model and infuse consciousness into dating  in the city? And when we do find a partner, how can we build a grounded relationship, full of treats-- not tricks? (big q’s, I know). Let's just say we're stepping into the no-ghosting zone.


Join us on Sunday, October 11th from 1-3 where we’ll be chatting about dating mindfully and conscious partnerships.  Because we all know, NYC needs a shot of authenticity and grounding when it comes to the dating and relationship rodeo.

We’ll be exploring:

·  What does dating mindfully look like?


·  What is a conscious relationship? What are the mindsets of people in conscious relationships?


·  Am I projecting my needs and desires onto my potential or current partner? How can I give what I need to myself instead of relying on someone else to fulfill it?

And…new! For this tea, we’ll be exploring it at a new location: my cozy and comfortable apartment in Williamsburg, with delicious teas and food from women-owned, NY-based businesses. Our afternoon includes:

·  Delicious tea from Serendipitea, a woman’s owned NY-based company. Get ready to try several types of drinks that will have you relaxed and rejuvenated.

·  Scones and goodies from from locally-owned Sugar Cotoure in Williamsburg. Trust me, I can’t get enough of this delicious bakery down the street.

So, come on over! See you then.

Xo

Carla

One important note: the point of this discussion is to talk about conscious dating and relationships. No energy vampires or talk of gremlin ex's permitted-- this is a positive conversation about what is possible, not what's happened.


***Also, in case you needed a reminder: this tea is open & welcomes anyone who identifies as a woman, single/engaged/married, and all sexual orientations.**


What is tea+purpose?

tea+purpose builds environments that cultivate radical authenticity. We ask the questions you haven’t been able to put your finger on, the questions that get you clearer on who you are, more alive, more aligned – and give you a community of women to sit across the room from and discuss them with. If you’re hungry for the next level of your life and craving that spark that happens when empathetic women start talking about the good stuff, you've met your match. You can check out our site more more details: http://www.teapluspurpose.com/ and sign up for our newsletter: http://bitly.com/tpluspemail
results.how_to_find_us: Once you sign up, you'll be sent the exact address in an email before the event. This tea will be hosted at my apartment in Williamsburg, off the Graham L train.
results.name: Trick or Treat: the Myths & Realities of Conscious Dating & Relationships in NYC

results.description:
Transmission Meditation with Meryl Tihanyi Alternate Sundays Beginning March 1st
1:00-3:00pm
Free Do you want to help the world and also build a stronger connection with your own spiritual nature? Transmission Meditation is a simple group meditation that provides both a dynamic service to the world and the opportunity for powerful personal spiritual development. *It is a group meditation based on the Science of Triangles, that makes possible the scientific distribution or transmission of highly potent spiritual energies into the world.
*It is the creation, in conscious co-operation with the Masters of Wisdom, of a vortex or pool of higher energy for the benefit of humanity.
*It is a combination of two yogas: Karma yoga (the yoga of service) and Laya yoga (the yoga of energy or chakras).
*Introduced to the world in 1974 by artist and author Benjamin Creme, there are now hundreds of Transmission Meditation groups active in many countries around the world.
*It is safe, and will enhance and complement any other spiritual practice or service activity in which you may already be engaged. Come to a FREE introduction to Transmission Meditation, followed by a group meditation.
results.name: Transmission Meditation with Meryl Tihanyi

results.description:
Dear Dharma Friends,

We will be holding a moving and sitting meditation followed by a Dharma talk on the 6-Paramitas, part 3.

1:00 - 2:00 Sitting/moving meditation 

2:00 - 3:00 Lecture 

The lecture will be given by teacher Harry Miller.  Harry  studied  with  Master  Sheng  Yen  for  over  30  years.  He  was  editor  of  the  Chan  Newsletter  for  over  10  years,  is  a  frequent  contributor  to  Chan  Magazine,  and  a  lecturer  at  Chan  Meditation  Center (CMC).  He  is  a  board  member  of  Dharma  Drum  Retreat  Center  and  a  member  of  the  Dharma  Teachers  in  Training  at  CMC.  He  holds  a  B.A  in  French  and  English  literature  from  Sarah  Lawrence,  and  an  M.A.  in  Chinese  Literature  and  M.Phil.  in  Comparative  Literature  from  Columbia  University.

Look forward to seeing everyone,

_/|\_

Organizer

------------------------------------------------------

Dharma Drum Mountain Buddhist Association is an orthodox Zen/Chan international organization.  Their New York area affiliates info are the following links: <<a>www. chancenter.org</a>> <www.dharmadrumretreat.org>

This is a co-ed adult pick-up game for all levels. 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash to the game. 

RSVP closes at 11:15AM (2 hours before the game)

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.

results.description:
Join Unity for this very special workshop on the book "Living the Farm Sanctuary Life: The Ultimate Guide To Eating Mindfully, Living Longer, and Feeling Better Everyday" by Gene Baur with Gene Stone

Author Gene Baur will present the basic tenets of Farm Sanctuary life, such as eating in harmony with your values, connecting with nature wherever you are, and maintaining your health through a plant-based diet. And he will offer simple and practical ways to incorporate these principles into your life.

In this definitive vegan and animal-friendly lifestyle guide, you’ll learn how to transition and maintain a plant-based diet, engage in a mindful connection with animals and food, eat plants for personal health, and for the health of the earth.
results.name: Gene Baur: Living the Farm Sanctuary Life

results.description:
Please see info I have pasted below. Gene Wu is a member of our group and a wounded veteran.. He has created this event to honor fallen Marines he has known, one of whom took his life after serving abroad. He's working to create a program for veterans to get technical education to aid them in their return to the workforce and provide them with a community.

While I personally am not a veteran, I have a tremendous respect for what these fine men and women have gone through and what they continue to experience. We must do better by them and this is something we all can do to help.

If you're up for it make a team and do the ruck with them. If not support them with donations of time, money, and opportunity. 

Today’s veteran suicide rate is 22 a day. This means that the heart-wrenching reality is that a veteran decides to take his or her own life every 60 minutes. Together, we can stop this insidious epidemic. VetHack's mission is to bring 22 to Zero!

All veterans, veteran supporters, friends and family, those who have been deeply affected by suicide, and survivors of suicide are invited to join us on a ruck around Central Park. There will be FREE food, a FREE T-shirt, and special VIP guests.

You must register on the eventhack website vethack.eventzilla.net
results.name: VET HACK 2015 Ruck March

Come experience the Healing Power of Sound & Vibration from a range of wonderful instruments in a circle designed to open our hearts, relax our minds, and inspire our spirits. Utilizing Native American Flute, Celtic Harp, Singing Bowls, Didgeridoo and Shaman Drums & more! 

Sound Healing helps to:

• Relieve Stress 

• Calm Emotions

• Clear Your Thoughts

• Deepen Self Awareness

• Enhance Well Being

• Strengthen The Immune System 

• Enhance Your Connection To Your Purpose

Sage Logan: is a trained Musician and Composer. He was raised with family practices of African American folk magic known as Rootwork. He is also a Shamanic Practitioner, and has learned sacred ceremonies, and healing techniques first hand from indigenous healers, from the Lakota & Cherokee traditions, healers from Peru & Ecuador, the Maori of New Zealand, South African Sangoma’s & many more. Sage is an organizer, of the NY Shamanic Circle, NYC’s eldest Shamanic non-profit organization.

For Question Please Email [masked]

Dress comfortably for meditation, movement and relaxation. Please bring a notebook & pen, bandanna & water to drink. Musicians please feel free to bring and instrument with you to join in, meditative Instruments are especially welcome!

results.description:
Sniffle Sniffle....picnic season is almost over, but let's try to get at least one more in this year. Join us for the last picnic of the season. In celebration of October the theme of this picnic will be Oktoberfest....That means German themed foods and beer related items...or hmmm beer infused foods?  Be creative! 

If you are stumped for ideas on what to bring I have included some recipe links. Feel free to use any of these or come up with an idea of your own. 

http://www.bonappetit.com/recipes/slideshow/oktoberfest-recipes/?slide=1


http://www.foodrepublic.com/2012/10/04/our-25-favorite-oktoberfest-recipes/


http://www.epicurious.com/recipesmenus/holidays/oktoberfest/recipes


http://www.cookingchanneltv.com/recipes/german-recipes.html


http://allrecipes.com/recipes/2444/holidays-and-events/events-and-gatherings/oktoberfest/


To participate you must bring at least one type of German Oktoberfest food. Please keep in mind that you we are all cooking so you only need to make about one serving for every three people attending unless yours are bite size. 

 If you would like to drink with us please contribute beer, wine or cocktail. Remember open alcoholic beverages are not allowed in public places in New York City so please be discreet about it.  

This is a dog friendly event. 

If you don't want to sit on the ground please bring picnic blankets or even beach towels. 

The Fine Print

Please pick out what you would like to cook and confirm that you can make this event on Oct 11th. Let us know which dish you want to cook in your RSVP so we can avoid any repeats. Each cook may bring one non-cook to enjoy the meal!

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.

results.description:
This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending.  Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group.

HOW MEMBERS SUBMIT NOVEL SECTIONS:



Email your submission to [masked] 

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam
MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.
Send to [masked]

Attach your document. RTF and DOC are preferred. Please, NO PDF's or DOCx. 


What to Expect: Nine days before the meeting you will receive an email from Meetup with links to download each story for critique from our Dropbox account. Click on the link and download the stories.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.


Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next. You can find advice about how to give a critique here.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.name: Cam's Novel Group

results.description:
I love the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Since I was 18 and visited for the first time, it's been a source of inspiration for me as well as a place where I can marvel at just how significant artistic expression can be. I visit from time to time but haven't been in just over a year. I figure, why not share the experience and see if anyone would like to join me.


I've scheduled the Meetup for October 11th and would love to meet on the south side of the front staircase sometime before 2pm. The great thing about the Met is not only its sheer size (which aids in accommodating large groups), but its extremely inexpensive admission. Entrance is just a suggested donation - which means we all can attend for as little or as much as you'd like to pay. Back in college, I visited for the day (hours and hours) for .75 with a bunch of friends.

Let me know your thoughts and I hope to see lots of you there! 

Thanks,

Brett
results.name: The Met Meetup

results.description:
Achieving success takes hard work, dedication, and perseverance. What are your goals? Why do you want to achieve those goals? Who will benefit from your success? If you stop, who will you hurt? I want you to understand something, I have to ask myself these questions periodically when things get tough. I’m human.

 I’m not a robot.  I get tired, but I think about my WHY and surround myself with a team that constantly reminds me of my WHY. Who are your accountability partners? 

Finally,  TRUST THE PROCESS! This is another important ingredient of success. We may know what our WHY is, right? We may be grinding, and doing all the right things, but your goal is still out of reach. TRUST THE PROCESS. Nothing happens overnight. You can’t skip levels and expect to remain successful !  I accomplished helping others and achieved what they thought they couldn’t. I was more than prepared. I was ready to give that experience away for free, and I have for a long time! Success didn’t come right away, but I knew my why, and I trusted the process. Add these two items to your toolkit and you will reap the benefits. It won’t be easy, but if it was everybody would do it. Make the rest of you life the best of your life!
results.how_to_find_us: BE HERE DOORS CLOSE AT 230PM YOU DON'T WANT TO  BE LOCKED OUT !
results.name: YOUR WHY This is the most important ingredient for your success!

Let's meet up at Prospect Park at 2:30pm sharp! I have a few locations that we will walk to as a group. I ask everyone to be on time as we have models with us and a lot of photographers. The closest Subway which is about a 15 minute walk to location is the 15th St - Prospect Park F and G trains. But depends on where you are coming from. 


We will meet at the entrance to the park from 16th Street and Prospect Park Southwest Street. If you type in or copy and paste these coordinates to google maps you will see where we are: <a>[masked], [masked]</a>

Please bring props, costumes or just yourself. We will have models with a couple choices of clothes. I'm more than happy to help anyone who is new to photography or shooting conceptual work and share with you the way I work from concept to shooting. Just have a knowledge of how your camera works and a passion to create and we will make some awesome work. Donations are very much appreciated since I have to pay all the dues for this group. I think it's fair to ask for $5 per event but if you can't afford it please join us anyway!


We will have models and I'll post pictures here as I confirm them. If you or anyone you know would like to model please have them contact me at [masked]

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED per park rules(turf shoes and indoor shoes are good)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: We have a permit.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

The game is open for up to 24 players - (11v11 w/ 1 sub each team)

**SOCCER FIELD 6 IS NEXT TO BASEBALL FIELDS 11&12 (north of 97th St Traverse)**

(Leader- Silvia)

(Co-Leader- Francisco)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for any game. Games may be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

English - Spanish - French - Italian - Portuguese - Arabic - Russian - German - Korean - Chinese - Japanese- Hebrew

Check-in, Event Schedule
3-3:30 pm Check-in, introductions $2 to join
3:30-4 pm Check-in, language sections $3 to join
4pm+ Arrivals Must find an organizer to check-in, $4 to join


RULES 
-MUST Sign up here, check-in, buy a drink/food, tip the service staff
-3 strikes rule. So sign up if you are definitely coming. We take attendance.

**The focus is not dating, it is languages. If you are disrespectful to others or disagree rudely with our rules, there is no place for you here and you will be removed from the group. We put in time and effort to host these language learning events and if you attend an event then you abide by our rules. Do not give us a reason to kick you out. **

It is up to our organizers' discretion who continues as a member of NYC's largest language learning community (That's us)
Like our Facebook.com/LanguageNYC page!

results.description:
Click here to see an AMAZING performance from NCJQ: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/emmanuel-baptist-church-jazz-vespers-presents-new-century-jazz-quintet-tickets-18691113624

The Emmanuel Baptist Church Jazz Vespers series is proud to present one of the most dynamic young groups in jazz today, the New Century Jazz Quintet (NCJQ). Their lively and triumphant performance will take place at the historic Emmanuel Baptist Church, located at 279 Lafayette Avenue, in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, from 3pm-5pm. NCJQ is a collaboration made to endure and make a long-lasting impression on its audience. 

Drummer Ulysses Owens and pianist Takeshi Obayashi are co-leaders, yet each of the band members contributes equally as writers and arrangers to the group's soulful rhythms. They lead with the belief that the music is strongest when the range of talents among the group is fulfilled. Bassist Yasushi Nakamura elevates the rhythm section with vivid intensity, whether he is swinging hard or using the bow to evoke an intimate mood. Alto player Tim Green brings supple warmth that conjures up the sounds of Kenny Garrett, Charlie Parker, and Wayne Shorter. Trumpeter Benny Benack III (who, alongside Owens, Wynton Marsalis has named on his list of “innovators in the new generation of jazz”) asserts a bright tone and witty exuberance throughout, providing a perfect compliment to Green's lyricism.

results.description:
Welcome back everyone! Come <a>play</a> some <a>beach volleyball</a> :) <a>Games</a> will be 4x4, rotating 3 teams, rally scoring to 15. 

Things to Know: Wondering what intermediate means? <a>Simply</a> put, you know what second ball means, and you can bump, set and spike.

Over all you can receive a <a>serve</a> and get it to the setter, reliably serve  and hot the ball over the net.  

Here is a <a>video</a> of the level of <a>play</a> we <a>expect</a> at the bare minimum . 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Nf4aM-hEzE

But this is how we think we <a>play</a>...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zmfd9etbXGE

We are a fun and friendly group. Any arguments over calls will be a redo.

• "Daria plays" are discouraged, but you get one freebie.

• Dancing between plays is allowed! 

• <a>Open</a> invites to drinks/ <a>lemonade</a> after the game :) Losers can drown their sorrows. 

• Sorry guys no refunds on day of cancellations!

• PLEASE LET US KNOW IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO MAKE IT.  Two no shows = ban for a month. 

Where is it?

Pier 25 is located by the <a>West Side Highway</a> between North Moore St. and Harrision St. It's the first Pier north of <a>Battery</a> Park City.

http://pier25.com/location/

Closest <a>subways</a> are: Canal (A, C, E), Franklin St. (1), <a>Chambers</a> on the (A,C, 2,or 3)

This week we will be <a>playing</a> at an Intermediate <a>level</a>. Bumping and setting consistently, and no carrying allowed. If you are unsure if you are at the <a>required level</a>, please <a>message</a> Joe and he will inform you if you can <a>sign up</a>. If you do sign up and are not at that level, you will be asked to sit this one out and refunded your payment. We will have an <a>open play</a> <a>meet up</a> again next week. Thanks!
results.name: 4x4 Intermediate

group.name: NYC Co-Ed Volleyball: Bump, Set & Spike!

results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
Priya will be hosting this fabulous event, see her message below:


Hi everyone, 

It's too cold and windy tomorrow. Next Sunday, Oct 11 is supposed to be sunny and around 70. Let's meet at 4, same place. Apologies for any inconvenience.

 I am holding a free 30 minute meditation class on Sunday, Oct 11 at 4 pm in Roosevelt Park, Edison, close to Menlo Park Mall. Join me to learn a radical and joyful meditation which will stop all of your unwanted, unnecessary thoughts that keep you swinging between the past and the future. By awakening a powerful energy, you'll feel the blissful silence of the present moment and reach real meditation as described in the Gita and other scriptures. We'll sit on blankets or you can bring chairs. Dress comfortably and wear socks. Tea and cookies will be served after and I'll answer your questions. We'll meet by the Japanese bridge next to the lake with the fountain off Oak Drive.

 Looking forward to seeing you! 

 Priya


Here is a link to a map of Roosevelt Park. Park in one of the lots near the Lake which is on Oak Dr. (accessed from Roosevelt Dr. or Parsonage Rd.) and then locate the Japanese Bridge. http://www.co.middlesex.nj.us/Government/Departments/IM/Documents/Maps/Roosevelt%20Park%20map.pdf

Note that this is a member-run meetup: no one is responsible for you but you. Your event host is not responsible for you or any injuries that could occur. Don't expect anyone to have first aid knowledge, supplies, or water for you. Just a bunch of like-minded people enjoying activities together! For more details see section 6.2 of http://www.meetup.com/terms/

As Dr. Pang wrote, Zhineng Qigong requires inward focus of the mind within the body, ".....any movement , as long as one is focused on the body mechanics, is Qigong. If the mind wonders away and the body moves mechanically, Qigong becomes exercise." - Zhineng (Chilel) Qigong: Overviews & Foundation by Dr Pang Ming.


This Sunday we will focus on a few aspects of visualization and imagination during our practice. We will perform "Level 1" twice in a row ~ about 40 min, have a short break (20 min) then 20 min Level 1 again. We will have sufficient time for our very beginners to ask questions and gain clarification in between the practice.

Please arrive a few minutes early to meet fellow practicioners and settle in. 

Hope to see you there!
Peter.

Click HERE to purchase tickets

Jessica Gould, soprano & Noa Frenkel, contralto
Diego Cantalupi & Diego Leverić, lutes
James Waldo, viola da gamba
Pedro d'Aquino, harpsichord and organ

While the Inquisition raged throughout Counter-Reformation Italy, the ghetto walls that separated Gentile from Jew were more porous than impenetrable. In celebration of the 50th anniversary of Nostra Aetate, we explore the cross-fertilization of Jewish and Catholic musical cultures that enriched the music of both synagogue and sanctuary.

Gorgeous melismatic singing…great depth of feeling – Voce di Meche

Works of Benedetto Marcello, Francesco Durante, Barbara Strozzi, Salomone Rossi, and unaccompanied Hebrew chants attest to a lively conversation, as do selections from the 1759 Hebrew libretto of Handel's Esther, commissioned by the Jewish community of Amsterdam in the year of the composer's death.

https://youtu.be/lI3ijrdZnlg

The exquisite 1607 library of the Fabbri Mansion, transported from Urbania, Italy during World War I, sets the stage for an international ensemble who come together to perform a unique program of unexamined treasures.

results.description:
Host:  Bill, "Fans of Capitalism."  http://www.meetup.com/Fans-of-Capitalism/events/225690306/

By taking advantage of publicly known advance information about how index funds are going to trade,some investors are able to game the stock market

I also frequently invest and specify the option "Reinvest Dividends". So it seems to me that when a stock pays a dividend, there will be a spike in demand right after the dividend is paid when all the brokers have to immediately buy that stock. But if an investor "games the market" by buying the stock when the dividends are announced and prior to when their are paid, and selling the stock into the spike, he will mitigate the situation. If enough of them do this, the spike will reduce to insignificance and their profit will be small, and the "market gamers" will have honestly earned their keep by providing needed liquidity."

results.description:
PICK-UP CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ CHELSEA PARK  

                                     Check our Facebook page:

          facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer


                                NO CLEATS OR STUDS ALLOWED

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cR_TuiCA8RM

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play THREE games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12.00 pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

***If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.***

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

CHELSEA PARK.

Between 27th and 28th street and 10th Avenue.

Take A, C or E to 23rd St and 8th Ave and walk to 10th Ave and 27th St or any subway line to 34th St and Penn Station and walk for about 8 minutes to 28th St and 10th Ave.

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

results.description:
By taking advantage of publicly known advance information about how index funds are going to trade, some investors are able to game the stock market.

I also frequently invest and specify the option "Reinvest Dividends".  So it seems to me that when a stock pays a dividend, there will be a spike in demand right after the dividend is paid when all the brokers have to immediately buy that stock.  But if an investor "games the market" by buying the stock when the dividends are announced and prior to when their are paid, and selling the stock into the spike, he will mitigate the situation.  If enough of them do this, the spike will reduce to insignificance and their profit will be small, and the "market gamers" will have honestly earned their keep by providing needed liquidity.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the front, and I'll have a sign on the table.
results.name: A Legal Way to Game the Stock Market

Hi everyone,

For October's book club, we will discuss Oliver Sacks' poignant autobiography, On the Move. Here's the link : http://www.bookculture.com/book/9780385352543 Oliver Sacks was of course a distinguished physician, an avid musicophile, and a prominent researcher, making science extremely accessible to people. However, his personal life as a gay man was riddled with fear, disappointment, and obstacles, oiling a deep sense of insecurity in Oliver. I am almost certain that he wasn't alone in such experiences; at least some of us may be able to relate. Anyway, hopefully you'll be able to join us for the discussion of this book. It is said that the nourishment of happiness can transform anything weak into powerful, chase illness away, make difficult things easy and heavy things light.


If we recognize the power of happiness, why are there so many people unhappy?

Is it possible to remain constantly happy?

In this book , Dadi Janki reveals the truth about happiness and the methods to free ourselves from sorrow and false beliefs, and to step into the happiness that we have inherited from the Divine.

Dadi gives us the insights into who we truly are and our relationships with the Supreme.

This awareness enables us to recognize peacefulness as a measure of the stability of our happiness.

quote by Dadi " Happiness is a great property. Through Raja Yoga, we attain the power to constantly dance in happiness. When one becomes light and might, than everything becomes right"

UPDATE: 10/9/15 - You can buy tickets for the 10/11/15 screening at the Maysles Cinema Box Office for $8. RSVP here to attend & your name will be on the HarlemGo Meetup list at the box office the day of the event. Early arrival is strongly suggested - Maysles Cinema expects the October 11th screening to be sold out.

Maysles Cinema brings us another great documentary! "Stretch and Bobbito: Radio That Changed Lives" screens at Maysles Cinema on Sunday, October 11th @ 7:30pm. Live Q&A with Stretch Armstrong and Bobbito Garcia to follow the screening.

Stretch and Bobbito: Radio That Changed Lives: 


During the 1990s, Stretch and Bobbito introduced the world to an unsigned Nas, Biggie, Wu-Tang, and Big Pun as well as an unknown Jay-Z, Eminem, and the Fugees. The total record sales for all the artists that premiered on their radio show exceed 300 million. The late night program had a cult following in the art/fashion world and prison population as well. All would loyally tune in for the humor just as much for the exclusive tunes. Stretch and Bobbito brought a unique audience together, and created a platform that changed music forever.


Do NOT click "BUY NOW" button on the video below - that is for their streaming service at $12.99 and is not the HarlemGo offer.

https://vimeo.com/140348043

Our Meetup


We'll meetup at Les Ambassades Bar & Restaurant next door (341 Malcolm X Blvd.) for drinks and a short meet-and-greet @ 6:00pm and then head over to the theater at 7:00pm for the screening, which starts at 7:30pm.

You can buy tickets for the 10/11/15 screening at the Maysles Cinema Box Office for $8. RSVP here to attend & your name will be on the HarlemGo Meetup list at the box office the day of the event. Early arrival is strongly suggested - Maysles Cinema expects the October 11th screening to be sold out.


If you are attending, please try not to arrive later than 7:00pm for best seating.


As always, feel free to call or text Daniel at[masked] if you have any questions, or simply post your question below. Thanks!

results.description:
Photo Credit: Jazzville, NJ member, Maurice Jefferson

Robin's Nest in Linden is truly one of the friendliest venues we've ever been to. Walk in once and you're part of the family.

Plus, it doesn't hurt that the open jam session lets everyone join in the fun. Musicians and vocalists are invited to get on stage and join the band for a few songs.

Over the years, we've had members grace us with their talents and it's always fun to see someone you know join the band for a few numbers.

There is no cover and the food is excellent, so bring an appetite!

Your GPS is not misleading you

Robin's Nest is in a very residential area. Most first-timers think their GPS is taking them the wrong way. Just continue to follow it. Once you get to the club, it's very visible amongst all the houses.

A Note About Parking

It's a small lot and double parking is common. If you are on a time schedule, it's best to park on the street so you don't get blocked in.

The area around the club is very safe and there is plenty of space on the surrounding streets.

How To Find Us

Robin's Nest is a cozy little place, so you shouldn't have any trouble locating us, but if this is your first time joining the group, you might not recognize us right away.

Here are three easy ways to find us:

• look for the Jazzville, NJ Meetup sign: http://bit.ly/zBZxVL

• look for me: http://bit.ly/zP11QP

• ask at the bar for the "Jazzville, NJ Meetup" group

Don't be shy! Come introduce yourself and partake in the music and merryment!

peace and jazz,

D.A.
results.why: Robin's Nest is the place to be on Sunday evenings! If you're a singer or musician, you can join the band on stage. If you're not, just get ready to be blown away by the talent!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask at the door or the bar for the Jazzville Meetup group or look for the Meetup sign.

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session

  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=633153420</a>

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125361<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631567294">

</a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. <a href="http://www.SwingRemix.com">www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

group.name: New York's East Village Stand-Up Comedy Meetup

results.description:
This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to give us complimentary admission for meetup free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up, as you know I dont charge for this meetup, so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

This week we got:
Host: Maddog Mattern Brings you Hadiyah Robinson (comedy central), Gregory K (Orange is the new black reds husband), Jared Freid (MTV), Paul Virzi (Opens for Bill Burr), Chris distefano (MTV's Guy code) and Godrey, and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs.

Show starts at 8pm sharp so please be on time! We can also do 10pm so if you all would prefer that for the future let me know.
results.name: Sunday Comedy Central Meetup at Stand Up NY 2 drink min. Complimentary tickets

group.name: Alternative to the Bar Fun Things To Do In NYC Today!

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
It's that time of year again where we check in on Rick Grimes and his rag tag crew of survivors.  Who will make it out this year?  Who will die and who will join the team!  

Come on out and see what happens at this year:

                             Walking Dead Season 6 Premiere


Lets root for our guys to survive and see what crazy adventures in this post-apoctiliptic world! 

We will also be joined by an awesome crew, Divisi6n! Lets welcome our fellow walking dead fans for a fun filled night!

Schedual: 

8:00pm - Arrive, socialize and theorize

9:00pm - Watch the Premere episode! 

10:00pm - Chill, chat and debrief on the crazy things that happened in the episode

Food/Drink - Bar has full food and drink menu

venue.name: KARMA

results.description:
CALLING ALL DEAD FANS 

KARMA is gracious enough to provide us their upstairs lounge complete with comfy sofas and large screen viewer with surround sound to watchTHIS SEASON's WALKING DEAD!!!

Karma will have dinner and drink specials just for us.  We usually watch the previous episode from 8-9pm casually with the lights up and discuss our theories and predictions about the show .

Then stay for the main event! Be warned: The lights go down and it will get pretty quiet once the 9pm episode begins.


WARNING: THERE MAY BE SPOILERS IN THE COMMENTS

Hope you are all well and enjoying the Fall.

I am offering an Energy Transmission on Sunday Nights at 10PM, especially for weight loss!

Good nutrition is the core, for good health and successful weight loss, and good energy nutrition is important as well.

This will help you to relax, recharge, replenish, and will help you with stress eating, cravings, and to keep focused, and to feel better about your body and yourself.

A special and delicious vitamin essence, will fill you up with good nutrition, which will help you fill up with the good stuff, therefore you will feel more satisfied with less food, and helps you to absorb the nutrients your body needs.

This will also relax and strengthen your adrenal glands, and help to revitalize all of your glands and organs.

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

I will have this each and every Sunday at 10PM! And, in the comfort of your own home.

All you need to do is relax, and intend to receive the Weight Loss Energy Transmission from Jae.

It's that easy, and then you can just relax and enjoy! Do not worry about falling asleep, because the energies work great while you're sleeping. They will work even if you are distracted or if you forget.

All you need to do is to RSVP so that you are on the list.

Please RSVP for each week that want to be included so that I know you're in.

Hope you'll participate in the next Weight Loss Challenge in October!

I'd love to see you!

Hope to see you real soon!

 

All the very best,

Jae

results.description:
This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
</a>

<a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/e/lenape34-2015-the-origins-walk-tickets-18499790371?ref=ebtn">

http://lenape34.squarespace.com/storage/LENAPE34HeadGraphic2015.jpg?width=500https://www.eventbrite.com/custombutton?eid=18499790371

This Columbus Day 34 mile walk starts at the train station in Millburn, NJ and follows an old marked trail called the "Lenape Trail" in beautiful South Mountain, Eagle Rock and Mills Reservations. It includes suburban towns such as Montclair, West Orange, Verona, Bloomfield, Nutley, and Belleville, and ends in urban Newark.

This is the fifth annual LENAPE34 which is a very challenging yet very popular annual event for the FreeWalkers. The walker is faced with about 50% wooded trail and 50% suburban and urban sidewalks and streets. Shorter daylight hours add to the physical and mental challenge.

There are alternatives for shorter segments. So you may choose to do less but can still walk along with the group. We'll also have the support of two train lines for mass transportation both to and from several points along the way. Since its on a Monday, we'll have the benefit of working with a full weekday schedule for this particular walk - allowing more frequent trains for your convenience. There are also several buses running in the area.

As always, the walk is free and everyone is invited. Most of this trail is a major segment of the Liberty Water Gap Trail, the 130-mile east-to-west trail across the entire state of New Jersey. Its name "Lenape" suggests honoring the Native American ancestors of our area on a day where we also honor the discovery of America. So, we're tagging this event the "Origins Walk".

This is an effort to support the revitalization of the Lenape Trail and the Liberty Water Gap Trail concept as well as help support a unique natural-to-urban trail and pedestrian environment which should be seen and experience by more citizens.

NOTE: We will use be using the old southern segment in South Mountain Reservation - not the western continuation (East Hanover) of the Liberty Water Gap Trail.

Visit http://lenape34.org for more information.
results.name: Lenape 34 - The Origins Walk 2015

results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is My Neighbors.

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.
results.name: Weekly Photo Project - My Neighbors

results.description:
It is Columbus Day. Do you rather stay at home or come out enjoy the beautiful fall foliage Bear Mountain has to offer?

HIKING AT BEAR MOUNTAIN

Bear Mountain State Park is situated in rugged mountains rising from the west bank of the Hudson River. The park features a large play field, shaded picnic groves, lake and river fishing access, a swimming pool, Trailside Museums and Zoo, hiking, biking and cross-country ski trails. An outdoor rink is open to ice skaters from late October through mid-March. The Perkins Memorial Tower atop Bear Mountain affords spectacular views of the park, the Hudson Highlands and Harriman State Park. Perkins Memorial Drive and Tower are open from April through late November, weather permitting. - See more at:  http://nysparks.com/parks/13/details.aspx

Besides the thirty-five 3500 foot peaks in the Catskills, there are many other smaller mountains to climb. In addition, there are hundreds of miles of trails to hike. There are also MANY other places to hike also. 

Bear Mountain: Loop
Difficulty: 3 (Moderate)
Round trip: 3.4 miles
Total climb: 1200 feet
Internet Maps: GPSies

Park in any of the parking lots at the Bear Mountain Inn off Route 9W. The two trails that allow access to Bear Mountain are the Appalachian Trail and the Major Welch Trail. Anyone not familiar with the area will probably miss the point at which the Major Welch Trail leaves the paved loop around Hessian Lake. I recommend taking the Appalachian Trail up the mountain the first time and using the Major Welch to return. Head for the outdoor ice skating rink. As you walk from the rink to Hessian Lake, a paved trail leads up a hill. This was the access road to the old ski jump which has not been used for MANY years. Follow the white blazes of the Appalachian Trail as it winds its way up the mountain. In some spots there are some bare rock faces to climb up at angles over 40 degrees. Some people go around while others go right up the rock. 

See more at http://www.catskillhiker.net/Trails/trails_harri.shtml

After the hike, we will have food and attend the Oktoberfest at Bear Mountain. GERMAIN FOOD AND BEER, ENTERTAINMENT, CRAFT VENDORS AND MUCH MORE ...

Note: Oktoberfest will take place at Anthony Wayne Recreation Area this year.


Depart Date: October 12th Monday; arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 8:30 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map) 

Depart 9:15 AM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of West 43rd St. & 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Depart from Oktoberfest at 2:30 PM, and expect to be back in NYC at 4:00 PM and Flushing at 4:30 PM.

Cost: Early birds $29 for first 8 spots or 14 days in advance; afterward Regular $39.

Trip includes: Round trip transportation from NYC, Bear Mountain hiking, admission to Oktoberfest, tolls & park parking fee.

Buy Ticket Here: http://oct2015hikingbearmtn.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me the amount indicated above to [masked] to avoid transaction fee (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. Your spot is NOT confirmed until your payment is received.

Maximum: 15

Refund Policy:

* $10 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance; 
* 50% refund if cancelled 7 days in advance; 
* No refund for cancellation or no show within 7 days.

Pictures from the previous trip:

http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/25205122/

By RSVPing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms to the Waiver & Release of Liability set forth by NYC Active Young Singles.
