Register for this event at http://www.pre-dating.com/westchester-speed-dating/ . Use code PDPSMU for a $5 discount!

 Why Check Out Speed Dating?

By now you know it takes meeting a number of people before you find someone you click with. (Sometimes it seems like hundreds!) The problem is, how do you meet them in the first place? There are bars, blind dates, dating services, online, etc. but they all have their disadvantages and they take time...lots of it. Plus it’s no fun is it to risk rejection over and over again striking up conversations with people you don't even know are single,if you even get the courage to speak to them. And if the conversation goes well it is still awkward exchanging phone numbers.

 With Speed Dating, you meet up to 12 (and sometimes more) singles your age range in about 2 hours. Afterwards, if there's interest (you discreetly circle on your interest sheet who you would like to hear from again), you'll get an email with links to contact these event participants. There's no pressure, no rejection, no embarrassment and no games!

 Events are posted in multiple MeetUp Groups, websites, FaceBook pages, and more. This event will fill up!  Your RSVP here is not registration. All attendees must Register for this event at http://www.pre-dating.com/westchester-speed-dating/ . Use code PDPSMU for a $5 discount!

Mondays are the beginning of our work week and many of us feel like half the world woke up on the wrong side of the bed. The prompt is "that damned cat"


Remember, our prompts are OPTIONAL. You may use them in anyway you want (as a title, theme or subject) or skip it completely and bring your own work.

Our format HAS CHANGED: 1-4 pages, double-spaced (with your name on it, and enough copies for all attending).

See you then.

NOTE: It is my hope that this meeting will move upstairs, but look for us first downstairs.

NOTE #2: If you arrive early (before 6:45) look for me in the Cafe section.

Note #3: I would love to avoid having this meeting exceed three hours in length. To keep this meeting under the 3 hour limit, here are the changes effective immediately:

1. Don't be late. We start at 7.
2. When we're giving our feedback (the second half of the meeting), please limit yourself to 2 comments. Feel free to write tons on the pieces of work, but when speaking, everyone gets 2.
3. If you were unable to read something (for whatever reason), then you don't comment. (That one is sort of obvious) -- Read what you can, that's what matters.

Note #4 -- If you don't have enough copies of your work to pass around, pass out what you have. We're all adults, and we'll manage.

Note #5 -- Please staple your stuff (AND PUT YOUR NAME ON IT) together. It makes this whole process so much easier.

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

The evening will begin promptly at 7:00 pm.

Please be punctual and check-in prior to 7 pm in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Community Circling Practice Night will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6-6:45 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7-10 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below!

What’s it like to experience Circling?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month  (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at [masked]

LOCATION: Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)
NY, NY 10010

 
August 3:  Experienced Circlers Only
August 10:  Beginners at 6 and Experienced Circlers 7 pm
August 17:  Experienced Circlers Only
August 24 :  Experienced Circlers Only
August 31 : Be sure to join us for the large Community Circling Night where our community comes together for a robust night of circling with multiple facilitators and amazing group presence exercises. These nights include intro for newcomers. Register here: https://communitycircling.eventbrite.com/

Our mission is to bring you true old world recipes that will delight the most fastidious of palates.To use the finest and freshest ingredients in every recipe we prepare. To serve you with honor and professionalism. To remain consistent with the quality of our food and service. To create an ambiance that is aesthetically and visually pleasing.To remain steadfast in adhering to our principals.


 Chef Michele Lepore was born and raised in Mola di Bari, Italy and attended the Culinary Institute “Armando Perotti” in Bari. Michele worked more than seven years in different Regions of Italy, perfecting his culinary skills and genuine flavor of each dish. He worked diligently toward his dream of someday becoming a chef in one of New York City’s finest restaurants. With unyielding perseverance and never loosing sight of his goal, Michele accomplished his dream. Now, after thirty years as a Chef for the finest restaurants in New York, Chef Michele wants to utilize his knowledge and expertise to bring a greater dimension of Original Italian Cuisine to Westchester.

Chef Michele is very passionate about his culinary creations and adamant about preserving the Old Fashion Italian Traditions. He carefully selects the freshest and choicest ingredients for his original recipes and cooking techniques, constantly perfecting consistency, quality and presentation.

using original recipes with the freshest and finest ingredients”

Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

24 Hours Cancellation Policy

Our October book is 2015: All the Light we Cannot See by Anthony Doer.

Doerr's second novel, All the Light We Cannot See, set in occupied France during World War II, was published in 2014. It received significant critical acclaim and was a finalist for the National Book Award for Fiction.[3] The book was a New York Times bestseller and was named by the newspaper as a notable book of 2014.[4] It won the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction in 2015.


As always, we'd love to have you join us, even if you haven't read the whole thing, if you've never come before, or you haven't been here in months. We don't care. We're not one of those clique-y groups. Come on by and pull up a chair.

Come join us on Monday, October 12th!

Happy reading,

P.S.#2: If you do need to cancel for some reason, please do so with as much advance notice as possible. We’ve now have more than 400 members and we may well have a waiting list for our events. By canceling as soon as you can, you enable others to participate as well, which is nice for all.

About Enviromental Green Drinks Gatherings

Environmental Green Drinks is an informal monthly get-together for people interested in green living, sustainable business and building communities that are safe for living, biking, walking and growing food. We meet at places where the food is excellent and the prices are good.

Green Drinks are open, admission is free and new faces are always welcome, so come and join us some evening!

Acerca de las Reuniones Green Drinks

Green Drinks es un informal evento social para gente interesada en la sostenibilidad y el medio ambiente. Las reuniones facilitan el intercambio informal de ideas y estrategias "verdes" y colaboraciones comunitarias e individuales. Conversamos sobre alternativos fuentes de energía limpia, producción agrícola urbana, la comida natural y orgánica, comprar local, los empleos verdes. . . y la justicia ambiental. Nuestros encuentros están abiertos a la comunidad y todos encontrarán una calurosa bienvenida.

results.description:
Level: Android Intermediate Session

Have you ever been interested in adding push notifications to your Android app? Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) 3.0 was announced around the time of Google I/O 2015. With GCM 3.0 there are a few new features added that make revisiting the topic worth your time (cross platform with Android, iOS, and Chrome support, topic messaging, diagnostic tools).

This session will be focussed on setting up a GCM client in an Android application.

Please try to be on time! Please remove your RSVP if you know you're not going to be able to make it.

Feel free to bring your laptop, tablet, or paper to take notes.

How to get to the room:

Once you are on campus at NJIT, find the GITC building using this map.

You are looking for this building.


Walk up the ramp into the building and walk down to the elevator to the 3rd floor. Find room 3710. We will try to put up signs to lead you the right way.


Getting to NJIT

Car:

Enter 154 Summit St, Newark, NJ 07102 as the address into a GPS. This is the address for the NJIT parking deck. At the gate of the parking deck press the red button and tell them that you're at NJIT for an event in the campus center. They'll let you right in. Remember where you parked and then head down to the GITC building (there is a campus map directly outside of the deck). Parking is free.

Train:

Take any New Jersey Transit train or the PATH to Newark Penn Station. Get off at the station and go to the main lobby and from there find the McDonalds. When facing the McDonalds make a left to go downstairs to the "Light Rail". Buy a ticket from one of the machines and get it stamped. The cost is $1.50 during rush hours (4-6pm), but you are free to buy the "Underground Fare" ticket for $0.70 anytime before/after that rush hour time window. Take the Grove St train and get off at the Warren St/NJIT station stop. It is 3 stops away (5 minute ride) from Penn Station. When you get off, take the stairway to your left. You will then find a campus map that will help you locate the GITC building.

Here is the NJ transit map that will help you get to Newark Penn Station:

NJ Transit PDF

results.description:
Join us for Monday evening inspiration! We'll share a writing prompt and refreshments at Cuppa Pulp Writers' Space. Led by Donna Miele or Writing Beyond the Basic's Jean Marie Donnelly. 

Evening write! easily accommodates both poetry or prose, but we do try to gear prompts toward helping writers explore elements of longer-term projects, most often character development, setting development, and narrative voice. Discussion often incorporates, naturally, other issues we face when working on longer pieces.

We will continue to schedule Monday evening write! regardless of attendance, but will cancel if less than three writers have RSVP'd. (That means that if it's just going to be the leader and one other writer, we will cancel.) So don't forget to RSVP at least one day in advance if you intend to come!

See detailed directions here. Hope to see you!
results.how_to_find_us: We're in the Rockland County Times building at the corner of Main and First in Nanuet, NY. Park on the street, behind the building, or in the Rand parking lot across the street, also corner of Main and First. Detailed directions at www.cilk119.com
results.name: write!

results.description:
Join us and the NYC Trivia league every week for the best bar trivia in New York. Compete throughout the night testing your knowledge on 5 rounds of trivia on varying topics. Possible rounds have ranged from European history to cartoons that don’t wear pants. It is time to prove the worth of that overpaid education and win some free drinks! 

$50 for first place 
$25 for second place 

$15 for third place

We've won 1st and 2nd place on countless occasions! Winnings are spent the week after.

#MorningAfterPilsner

Location is Think Coffee, just south of 14th Street on 8th Avenue (near the 14th Street A, C and E train stop).  Start your week with some coffee, other drinks and lively English conversation!

results.description:
We will be discussing the contents of The World Peace Diet, Chapters 9 and 10: 

• Chapter 9: Reductionist Science and Religion

“There is no religion without love, and people may talk as much as they like about their religion, but if it does not teach them to be good and kind to beasts as well as man, it is all a sham.”—Anna Sewell, Black Beauty.

• Chapter 10: The Dilemma of Work

“When a human kills an animal for food, he is neglecting his own hunger for justice. Man prays for mercy, but is unwilling to extend it to others.” —Isaac Bashevis Singer

The World Peace Diet provides a transformative perspective on the multiple consequences of the food choices we make (or are made for us)—not just in terms of personal physical health, but also environmental health, cultural, economic, ethical and spiritual well-being too.

If you have read the book, this study group will be a good forum for sharing sections that meant something to you, changed the way you perceive the world or the way you interact with the world,

If you have not read the book but are an ethical and environmentally compassionate individual, and would like to explore ways to live more in alignment with your values, I think you will enjoy the discussion and be a valuable contributor.

Remaining chapters will be discussed in the following weeks.
results.name: Let's discuss The World Peace Diet - Chapters 9 & 10

results.description:
Science Fiction has, obviously, a lot to do with science. But also with philosophy, as we will explore in the course of this discussion.


Recommended readings, from Philosophy Now and IO9 magazine, can be found here.

RSVP for this event will begin on 9/22 at 7:30pm.

This meetup will take place at Massimo's apartment in Chelsea (near the 1, C, E, F, N, and R subways), which is conducive to a much more relaxed and far less noisy experience than a restaurant setting. 

The fee for the meetup is of $20/person, which includes food for the evening, a contribution toward the meetup.com fees to maintain the site, credit card fee, and taxes. Feel free to BYOB, or contribute $5/person/glass if you are okay with whatever we have in the house.

> Please notice new starting time! See you at 7:30pm! <

Details on how to get to the meetup will be provided to registered participants who have paid the fee. Please keep in mind that this event will take place at a private residence, so do NOT arrive early, since we will be cooking and setting things up, and do NOT linger afterwards, since your hosts will be cleaning up and relaxing after a good evening’s work. Thank you.
results.name: SciFi and Philosophy
Reading Modern Romance by Aziz Ansari

Please note: There is a $5.00 charge to participate in the jam. This fee is used to pay the jam leader. For more information about why there is a fee, click on the "home" tab and "read more".

Tonight's Jam Leader: Kim Mandrake. For more info about the jam leader, go to the meet up site.

results.description:
Fall is in the air and what better time to come together as a group and meditate. Whether you are new to meditation or have been practicing for years, please join us for our weekly practice.


Agenda: 

We will start with some simple exercises, followed by a guided meditation called the Twin Hearts Meditation. After the meditation, an optional Basic Pranic Healing session is offered followed by Q&A and discussion.


The session is by donation and a minimum of $10 is suggested. These donations will go toward paying for the room and supplies. If you truly cannot afford to contribute, join us anyway.

Please be sure to RSVP. Looking forward to seeing you all there!
results.how_to_find_us: Corner of Broadway and 11th St, 6th floor, last room on the right.
results.name: Twin Hearts Meditation and Introduction to Pranic Healing

Every Monday night, we're getting folks together at the beautiful renovated Lucky Cat Comedy Club downstairs at the Village Lantern for drinks, food and the Unarmed and Dangerous comedy show. results.description:
This will be the official Korean beginner's class. The class material will be provided. We will go through all the basics and foundations, and practice with fun activities.

If you know how to read Korean letters(Hangul) you can join the class. If you haven't learned at all but would like to join the class, please email me.

Since I need to book a space ahead, please consider your RSVP seriously and let me know if you can't make it after you said YES to come.

The location will be either near Bryant park or Korea town. The exact location will be sent to members privately. Please, email me at [masked] with your contact number if you can come. I will send mine so we can communicate better when the meet up happens.

The class fee will be $15 per person. Once you commit for 4 weeks series of classes it will be $40. Please, note you won't get a credit if you cancel your attendance on the same day. Be prepared for the class! :)

We may hang out and mingle after the class. I'm very excited to see you all and look forward to it! 
If you have any questions,please leave a comment.
results.how_to_find_us: Email me at MyKoreanLessonTutor@gmail.com
results.name: Korean beginner Plus

results.description:
Join our Christmas Blues Rock Ensemble in time to perform a great Holiday show in December!
We’ll be playing Christmas classics “Merry Christmas, Baby”, “Please come home for Christmas”, “JIngle Bell Rock” and more!
We’ll have 10 practices and then perform on Sunday, December 13th at Arlene’s Grocery at 3pm. SHOW

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village December 13th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Our show will be at 3pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand (starting in November) at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

CALENDAR

Our practice schedule starts Thursday 6-8pm on October 1st.

It is important that you attend to as many as you can if you plan on performing, a required 7 session minimum will be necessary to perform and VERY IMPORTANT that you come to the last 2 practices which will be with a drummer and a singer
results.how_to_find_us: between 7th and 8th Ave
results.name: Join our Christmas Blues Rock ensemble!

results.description:
• Description :Let's meet and have a great time dancing in One of NYC's Top Dance Parties as featured in Timeout New York Magazine, celebrating their 6th year @ Taj Lounge!
Great dinner and dancing experience, live music, performers and guest DJ's. 

• RSVP: To enjoy the reduced admission , Mention the code that you will see in the comment section, it is different every week !!

• Price: $10 if you RSVP on the meet up. 

• Time:  8 pm- 2am ( Salsa Lesson at 7.00pm)


• Address: Taj Lounge, 48 W 21st St, New York

• What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

• Do I need a partner ?: No, you don’t need to bring a partner. We rotate during the group class, It will give you the opportunity to dance and meet different people.
results.name: Salsa dancing with Salsa New York @ Taj Lounge: Live Music + Performances

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:
results.how_to_find_us: Price per class is $25.00. New students first class is $12.00, RSVP's encouraged.  Tell the receptionist you are here for Krav Maga and turn right to the Martial Arts room- can't miss us.
results.name: Krav Maga Level One

group.name: Krav Maga Basics, Rape Defense- NYC Midtown (Kravmaguy)

This will be a very special Side Ponytail. It will be the last Side Ponytail before creator and producer, Carolyn Busa, turns...oh no, 30! Come celebrate as she says goodbye to all things twenties. She'll be celebrating the night away with comedians and friends:

Mike Lebovitz (Last Comic Standing)
Emily Winter (Fusion, BackFat)
Lauren Vino (MTV News)
Lance Weiss (Gandhi Is That You?)
Tom Cassidy (Center City Comedy)
Samantha Ruddy (Laugh Your Asheville Off Fest)

Side Ponytail is every 2nd Monday at Over the Eight (594 Union Ave, Brooklyn) and features NYC's funniest (and nicest!) comedians!

Look! Side Ponytail was featured in TimeOutNY as one of the best comedy shows: http://www.timeout.com/newyork/comedy/the-best-nyc-comedy-shows-run-by-female-comedians

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?
We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

aAt the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us
https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnOn NYC

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

aAt the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us
https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnOn NYC

group.name: Alternative to the Bar Fun Things To Do In NYC Today!

results.description:
Baladi Beat Belly Dance resumes its weekly dance class in Jersey City with Tarik Sultan.

In this class you will learn how to dance like a natural and unlock your inner beauty! You will learn how to respond to the music in a way that allows you to express your emotions through movement. Other added benifits: Increase your muscle tone, stamina, coordination, posture. Releive stress and tension all while have fun and looking great!

All classes begin with a warm up consisting of the core movements, allowing you to develope your skills at your own pace. Wonderful friendly, accepting atmosphere, lots of encouragement and feedback! At Baladi Beat, you are never just another face in the crowd, but an individual!

Classes start this Monday 8:00pm to 9:00pm

$20 a single class, $45 for 3 classes, $60 for 4.

Cash or check made out to "Tarik Sultan".  To find out more about Tarik visit www.tariksultan.net/Class_Schedule.html

For more information call[masked]
results.name: Jersey City Belly Dance Classes Resume this Monday!

This event is posted on the First Time Upper West Side Moms meet up group (  http://www.meetup.com/Upper-West-Side-Moms/ ), but since it is for working moms, I am also posting it here. 

Come meet up with mothers who work in a baby-free environment.  Mothers-to-be, mothers on maternity leave, and all those wishing to discuss the challenges of work-life balance are also invited.  We will meet on the second Monday of every month.

results.description:
If you've always wanted to try Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu or MMA, this is the perfect class for you!  Instructors are experienced and attentive.

We'll start the class with warm up drills, followed by technique and end with live sparring. Stop by for some great training with friendly people! All levels welcome! 

Bring your gi if you have one.  If not, we have extras to lend.  Please arrive 10 minutes prior to class.

For more info about the academy and it's instructors:

http://www.abreceabjj.com 

Don't hesitate to inquire if you have any questions!
results.name: Intro to Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu/Mixed Martial Art

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, have the day off, or just coming from work...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play. A tennis pro will also be on-hand.


Note: it may be necessary to move people around to keep it interesting or match people with like skills.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

ATTENDANCE

Unable to attend or need to change the day? If you change your RSVP on the the MindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on your MindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show.  I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

These beautiful tennis courts are conveniently located at the end of the 3 train in Manhattan, which means they are just one block north. The surface is softer than most, well maintained, and has LIGHTS.


https://www.google.com/maps/place/2601+Adam+Clayton+Powell+Jr+Blvd,+New+York,+NY+10039/@40.8258611,-73.936799,17z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x89c2f67f79c87e27:0xba25e4f78a0fd23a

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>
results.name: Hitting Session (Frederick Johnson)

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)
results.name: Monday 8:15pm Tron Ball - Night Soccer @ LIC (7v7 game) for PS2G

Please bring at least one food item fo donation! Here are the most needed items:

• Cold cereal and oatmeal (low-sugar)
• Dried pasta
• Tomato sauce (cans please)
• Macaroni & Cheese
• Canned tuna (in water)
• Peanut Butter
• Canned vegetables (low or no-salt)
• Canned fruit (in juice)
• Canned soup (low-salt)
• Rice, 1 lb. bags (brown preferred)
• Beans (dried preferred)
• Milk (powdered, canned, and aseptic)

results.description:
Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $10 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.

http://www.nyurban.com/basketball/open_play_bb.html

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.
results.name: Basketball Open Play- Chelsea  B-C Level

results.description:
This week we will be learning the Samba and focusing on different kinds of timings there are in Samba! The focus will be learning different step variations with different rhythms to pinpoint just how rhythmical you have to be in Samba (and dancing overall).

We will be meeting in the Flamenco room on the left hand side. Wear comfortable sneakers or shoes and sweatpants or yoga pants are best as attire. Classes are $15 per person or $20 if you come as a couple. 

Looking forward to seeing all the dancers this week!

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.

We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. Tuesday, October 13, 2015, 8:00 AM - 4:00 PM Eastern Time (US & Canada)

Going Paperfree -- Automating Your Back-end Processes

The arguments for keeping electronic records to save office space, improve findability and reduce waste are well rehearsed, and yet billions of unnecessary paper copies are still printed around the world every day. Meanwhile, we have moved on to another battlefront – paper-free processes.

AIIM Paper-Wars Industry Watch found:

44% of organizations are only 10% towards their goal of paper-free processes.Legal and finance departments are considered to be the most resistant to paper-free working.60% of users have seen ROI on their paper-free projects within 12 months, and an impressive 77% within 18 months. 

AIIM Seminars will help you to identify progress towards paper-free processes, the triggers and decision-making processes, and the issues, benefits and ROI. 

Register today!

Register Now

results.description:
Hi folks
This coming Tuesday morning, we have the pleasure of having Rob Reid coming by and sharing his journey and insights!

Rob Reid is a high technology entrepreneur and bestselling author based in both Los Angeles and San Francisco, California. A former venture capitalist, he was the founder, CEO, and later Chairman of Listen.com, which created & developed Rhapsody – the first online music service to secure full-catalog licenses from all of the major labels.


Rob has worked with technology startups as an investor, board member, and formal advisor for over ten years. Companies in his portfolio have included IGN, Kareo, WeHeartIt, and Surf Air.


Rob majored in International Relationships at Stanford, later earned an MBA Harvard Business School, and was also a Fulbright Scholar in Cairo, Egypt. He is a member of the Council on Foreign Relations, and his books are published by Random House. His most recent novel (Year Zero) was a New York Times bestseller. It tells the story of a vast alien civilization which inadvertently bankrupts the entire universe by way of its unhealthy obsession with American pop music.

We'll get a chance to hear about all his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Tuesday!
results.name: NY Tech Week - Rob Reid (Rhapsody/Listen.com)

results.description:
Hey Golfers,

The Managing Director for the NFL Alumni Association has asked for some volunteers for a charity Golf event that they're having.  She needs 10 volunteers in total.  Hopefully a few of you can sign up for this as i'm sure this will be a memorable event.  If you are interested, please feel free to sign up here.  

This tournament will benefit both the NFL Alumni Association as well as the Independence Fund all while celebrating the 25th Anniversary of the 1990 New York Giants Super Bowl XXV Championship.  Each volunteer will receive an NFLA shirt as well as lunch on course, and a staff dinner.  They each will be paired with a fivesome that will include a member from the 1990 Super Bowl XXV Championship roster as the celebrity captain.  General information on the tournament is listed below: 5th Annual Hackensack Celebrity Golf Classic. Celebrating the 25th Anniversary of the 1990 Super Bowl Champions, NY Giants.  Celebrities scheduled to attend: Lawrence Taylor, OJ Anderson, Carl Banks, Stephen Baker, and many more NY Giants!  Benefits: Independence Fund & NFL Alumni Caring For Kids Independence Fund-  

The Independence Fund , Inc. was created in 2007 to assist severely injured Veterans in obtaining tools, therapies, and equipment they were not otherwise receiving from governmental agencies, especially in relation to mobility and quality of life.The NFL Alumni’s mission is to serve, assist, and inform our members to enrich their post- NFL lives. We care for kids and for our own, enabling our members to connect with each other and contribute to the community through charitable programs.

What you will you be volunteering for:  registration, scorekeeping for an assigned group, assisting with contests, etc.

results.description:
Global Fashion Capitals Conference, Symposium & Fashion Fair 10/13/15 *FIT/CUNY-

l

Global Fashion Capitals: Creative Industries

The multi-layered identity of New York as a global fashion capital has long been defined by the history of the garment industry, fashion and labor. The cultures and economies of the fashion industry and the city of New York have been and continue to be intertwined. The cultural economic impact of the fashion industry on New York City cannot be overstated. New York City’s fashion industry employs 180,000 people and accounts for 6% of the city workforce, generating $10.9 billion a year in total wages, and tax revenues of $2 billion. An estimated 900 fashion companies are headquartered in the city. New York Fashion Week contributes about $850 million a year to the local economy—about twice the economic impact of the 2014 Super Bowl.

Fashion is more than ever part of a wider landscape that intersects with other creative industries (media, visual arts, design, film, craft). Fashion, its manufacturing and culture industry, and its complex media apparatus have contributed to the transformation and histories of several world cities. In many cases, as in New York City, women and immigrants were largely responsible for building the garment industry; and it was their work that intersected with social reforms, political activism, gradual urban transformation and processes of globalization and gentrification.

Some of the questions the conference will address are:

How and why does a city become a Global Fashion Capital?
What role do the social media and the post-digital experience of today play?
How can labor, craft and design survive in the era of Instagram?
How do new technologies and big data affect our ways of life, thinking and consuming the city in the city?
Is there a new rhythm analysis that needs to be understood?
And how can we strengthen our right to the city and allow a new humanitarian sensibility and politics?

This one-day symposium is presented by Fashion Studies at The Graduate Center and the Master of Arts in Liberal Studies, in collaboration with the School of Visual, Media & Performing Arts at Brooklyn College and The Museum at FIT, and the support of Women’s Studies Certificate Program, the Master in Women’s Studies, The Committee on Globalization and Social Change, Data & Society, and The Futures Initiative.

A still from D.W. Griffith's short silent film The New York Hat starring Mary Pickford

The morning session will take place on the FIT campus and will consist of a student fair, where visitors can interact with members of the international fashion community. The morning will also include a fashion show featuring five designers from emerging fashion capitals and a panel discussion moderated by MFIT curators Ariele Elia and Elizabeth Way. For more information about the morning session at FIT, please visit: https://www.fitnyc.edu/24347.asp

The afternoon session will take place at the Graduate Center, CUNY, in the Proshansky Auditorium.


Tuesday, October 13, 2015

The Graduate Center, CUNY
365 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY
The Proshansky Auditorium

1:30 PM
Registration (register here)

1:45 PM – 2:45 PM
Roundtable 1: What makes a Fashion City?
Panelists: Joe Hancock, Veronica Manlow, Lisa Small, and Travis Haglin
Moderator: Eugenia Paulicelli

3:00 PM – 4:00 PM
Roundtable 2: Future Fashion in NYC
Panelists: Elizabeth Cline, Elizabeth Wissinger, Tabitha St. Bernard, and Minn Hur
Moderator: Tessa Maffucci

// Coffee Break //

4:15 PM – 6:30 PM
Film Screening: The True Cost (2015)
Followed by Q&A with director Andrew Morgan
Interviewed by Paul Julian Smith

7:00 PM
KEYNOTE: Global Fashion, Women, and the Creative Industries
A Conversation with designer Reem Acra and Valerie Steele, Director, Museum at FIT
Moderator: Maria Conelli, Dean, School of Visual, Media and Performing Arts, Brooklyn College.

World-renowned designer Reem Acra speaks with Valerie Steele of the Fashion Institute of Technology (FIT) in a featured event of the conference Global Fashion Capitals. Originally from Beirut, Acra studied at FIT in New York, and in Paris. She has dressed global style icons including Angelina Jolie, Madonna, Beyonce Knowles, and Jane Fonda. Acra’s prêt-a-porter and bridal collections are carried by top retailers, such as Bergdorf Goodman, Neiman Marcus, and Saks Fifth Avenue. Steele is the director and chief curator of The Museum at FIT and editor in chief of Fashion Theory: The Journal of Dress, Body & Culture.

*** Registration is free and open to the public ***

For more information about the morning session, which will be held at FIT, please click here.

Faculty Organizers at the Graduate Center: Eugenia Paulicelli, Veronica Manlow, and Elizabeth Wissinger

Student Organizers: Tessa Maffucci, Minn Hur, Chrislande Dorcilus, and Scarlett Newman
Global Fashion Capitals Symposium

results.description:
***********************

To join the Oct. Tournament please just go through our Join Page:  http://TennisNewYork.com/join
***********************


How does the TennisNewYork Tournament Work?

Every Match Counts *NEW* for 2015

Tennis Tournament Basic Concept

 Our tournaments are a single elimination format with a consolation bracket. Meaning you are guaranteed at least 2 matches. This tournament format will not be played at a single location over a weekend instead players are given 7 to 10 days to play each round's match.

 Our tournaments will be mixed gender unless we have particularly strong female enrollment in a city. The tournaments will be singles based until we receive enough response to open it up for doubles. Players will be grouped in brackets with players no greater than .5 of their current TLN League Rating. Meaning Skilled - 3.0 players will be matched with other 3.0 players and at most with Competitive - 3.5 level players. Competitive - 3.5 level players could be grouped with Advanced - 4.0 players but will not have Elite 4.5 level players in their bracket.

Our Guarantee

 We need at least 6 players to make a tournament bracket. If we can NOT reach this criteria then we will refund your entry fee and give you the next tournament for no cost. Our hope is to run multiple skill level brackets for each tournament. We are NOT going to show early enrollment for the tournaments. Also the 7-day money back guarantee expires as soon as the tournament starts. Tournaments will not allow for late enrollment.

Leveling

 All tournament players will need to have played 4 league/season or tennis ladder legacy matches before they can enter into a tournament. Players will be entered into the tournament that associates with their TLN's Player Rating. If a player wants to participate in a second draw at a rating higher than their Player Rating they will be allowed too.

Your Schedule and Availability

 These tournaments will be kicked off on Thursday's giving the first round opponents two weekends to play the first match and then each following round will have a full week to play the match. Players need to be local for at least the first 3 weeks after kickoff. Players with 1-week work trips or week long vacations during the first 3 weeks shouldn't participate in the tournament.

Seedings

  The TennisNewYork staff will seed 25% of the participants based veteran status (Most number of matches played in their career) with the program. If we have 8 players enrolled we'll seed the top 2 players, 16 players the top 4 players. The rest of the players will be randomly entered into the draw.

Consolation Bracket

 We will run a consolation bracket for the players who lost their first match. Seedings for the consolation bracket will be randomly selected by the TennisNewYork staff. The winner of the consolation bracket will receive a $25 Tennis Warehouse Gift Card.

Where to Play?

  Because the seeding of the tournament is mainly randomize the higher seed will NOT have home court preference. The league strongly suggests you meet half-way to cut the commute in half for both players. We provide an extensive list of tennis courts that have user submitted ratings. If two players need guidance they can certainly email our staff for suggestions.


Special Note for NYC players: We don't have any special privileges to use the courts throughout New York City. You do need to follow by the rules provided by the Parks Department. How to reserve tennis courts in NYC: NYC Park & Rec.


Playing Format

  The preferred playing format for tournaments should be 2 sets with a 3rd set tie-breaker or 2 out of 3 sets. If the two players can't agree the default format will be the 2 sets with a 3rd set tie-breaker. In NYC we will accept 10 game pro set results mainly due to court availability.

Target Audience

  This will be our most competitive format. The target audience is for the player who are good sports and love to play competitive matches.

Prize Pool

 The prize pool will be based upon enrollment in each bracket. A tournament can have multiple brackets. The tournament prize structure is based around our partner Tennis Warehouse (TW).

6 to 10 players: $50 TW Gift Card for the winner*, $25 TW GC for Finalist, $25 TW GC for Consolation bracket winner
11 to 16: $100 TW GC for the winner* + Trophy, $50 TW GC for Finalist, $25 TW GC for Consolation winner
17 to 24: $150 TW GC for the winner* + Trophy, $50 TW GC for Finalist, $25 TW GC for 3rd & 4th place, $50 TW GC for Consolation winner
25+: $200 TW GC for the winner* + Trophy, $100 TW GC for Finalist, $25 TW GC for 3rd and 4th place, $50 TW GC for Consolation winner

 All tournament champions will be receive an entry into the End of the Year National Tourneys at the champions discounted rate.

Cost to Participate

 The cost will be $19.95 per tournament.

Join Today!!

  So Join Today and we'd be happy to get you enrolled into the next tournament.
results.name: Oct. Tournament

Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
The New York City Wine & Spirits Professionals presents:

Stories from the beverage industry: My first year as an Entrepreneur

6PM - 7PM : Welcome : discovering the rare grapes of Languedoc

Our host, "La Maison du Languedoc Roussillon" will be introducing some of the rarest and less known varietals from the Languedoc region. The tasting will present locally grown wines presented by the producers themselves.

7PM- 7:45PM : Speakers panel

For this first Meetup, we are honored and proud to feature such great industry professionals.


Get ready for some insight, anecdotes, dos and don'ts, and some of the most valuable points of view from our panel.

Our 3 speakers will share with us their beginnings in the industry, how they managed to navigate in it, and sometimes how they turned mistakes into strength. 

Speakers: 


Steffan Bankier: Founder of Public House Wine

As a french-raised New York, Steffan was born with a love for food, wine and hospitality. After spending years working in advertising for major alcohol brands, Steffan quit his job to start Public House Beverage Corp, an alcohol brand with a focus on high end boxed wine. After spending several years building the brand up into major retailers like Fresh Direct & Whole Foods, it became too difficult to scale the business and the founders decided to sell it. After Public House, Steffan stayed involved in hospitality but focused more on technology which led him to his current job running Sales at a hospitality tech startup called ALICE. 


Antonia Fattizzi: Founder of Cork and Tin

Antonia has continuously demonstrated expertise in managing, marketing and selling alcoholic beverages for the past ten years. Consumer interests in brands such as Francis Coppola Wines, Partida Tequila, Bols Genever and Galliano have grown exponentially under her watch. In 2012, she founded Cork and Tin to serve as a voice, an advocate and a strategic partner for emerging brands.



Steve Luttmann: CEO/Founder of Leblon Cachaça: TBC


Steve Luttmann is the founder and CEO of LEBLON LLC, producer and marketer of Leblon Cachaça and Cedilla Liqueur de Açai. Mr. Luttmann has significant brand management expertise at Unilever and LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton / Diageo. As a Brand Marketer, Mr. Luttmann has managed various global brands. At LVMH/Diageo, his brand experience included Grand Marnier, Ruffino, and Casa Lapostolle.  He is fluent in Portuguese from his 3-year tenure in Sao Paulo, Brazil, leading the CICA tomato brands business in Brazil, and was previously fluent in German from studying and working in Cologne, Germany and Vienna, Austria. In 1997, Mr. Luttmann was named to the ‘Top 100 Marketers’ by Advertising Age Magazine as a result of his work on Five Brothers. Mr. Luttmann has an MBA from New York University, and a BS in Finance with Honors in Economics from Pennsylvania State University.



7:45PM-8:00PM: Q&A

8:00PM-9:00PM: Networking 

Wine will be served as we encourage everyone to network and interact with one another. 

IMPORTANT:

Don't forget to send us an email to tell us a little bit about yourself. 


If we can somehow make the right introduction to help you get a head start, we'll be more than happy!

Note: This is not a wine tasting but a meetup professional

Sincerely,

Albert & Simon
results.name: NYC Wine & Spirits professionals

It doesn't matter what the email says... if you received an email... you are on the list. general excel/vba topics from 6 to 6:30. then details for harvesting information from the internet. The Microsoft Conference Center, is free of charge. We plan on meeting on the 2nd Tuesday of every month, but there are changes occasionally. You should receive an email, if there's a cancellation. The Conference Center's security department, requires your first and last name, so please include your full name, within the body of your email. Sometimes, the map on this meetup link above, is incorrect, so please write down the address, (at 41st Street and 8th Avenue, NorthEast corner... i.e. not in Port Authority). If you don't get an email back from anyone, within a day or two, please send a 2nd request. I always learn something new at the group, like an advanced feature, or a glitch/bug to beware of. For example, did you know that formulas entered in the Named Range box calculate as "Array Entered". It's OK, to arrive half an hour early and use the free coffee machine. Try to go early, if it's your first time, in case you are not registered properly. If you arrive, and the the security personnel informs you of a registration problem, don't be alarmed, they will assist you. Please be patient. This event is scheduled for 5:45 PM and 6:00 PM. See link below. After you receive an email from the Microsoft Organizer, stating we will meet on this date, you may sign up for the 6:00 PM event, (no seating limitation, but the security desk closes a little after 7:00 PM). http://www.meetup.com/Spreadsheets/events/calendar/

results.description:
Topic:  Exchange Expert’s Guide to Troubleshooting Common Exchange Issues 


Meeting Abstract:  Steps to troubleshoot common Exchange Issues, and Recommendations for keeping your Exchange Servers in tip-top shape. 


Presenter: Ben Serebin, Founder/President of NY Exchange User Group.


Sponsor: Microsoft & NYExUG


Where:

New Microsoft office. 11 Times Square, between 42nd & 41st on 8th Avenue. Located across from Port Authority.

Doors Open 5:45pm and dinner arrives at 6pm.


Please visit the official NYExUG website posting for full meeting details such as Speaker BIO's, Product details, and more.

You can reserve your seat via the official NYExUG website's meeting (www.nyexug.com)or meetup if you show/email your FULL NAME by 10am day of meeting. FREE, Open to Public, and includes dinner.

Agenda

5:45pm - doors open/dinner arrives
6:30pm - main topic
8:30-9pm - raffle items

Folks attending will be able to win a various raffle items including Microsoft software. Free food, and open to all simply by RSVPing.

The meetings occur every 2nd Tuesday of every Month.

At our monthly meetings we have 1 or 2 main presentations covering various topics and discuss troubleshooting problems, adding new features and functionality, reviewing new products, and meeting/networking with other IT people (Exchange Admins, SysAdmins, IT Manager, IT Help Desk Support, CTOs, etc). Great way to learn about Microsoft Exchange Server in small, medium, and enterprise environments.

You can view past presentations on our website: nyexug.com

Past topics include: in-depth look at Microsoft's Redmond Dog-Food lab, live software replication demonstration, live hardware replication demonstration, Multi-site deployment recommendations, Configuring your firewall for Exchange 2003 and SP2 Changes (for the firewall), Moving your Exchange Server to a new Internet Connection, Groove, Exchange 2007, SAN Storage Solutions, Exchange Scaling Up, Server-side anti-spam solutions, Disaster Recovery, Outlook Direct Booking, Troubleshooting Exchange, Intro to Exchange and DNS, etc.
results.name: Exchange Expert's Guide to Troubleshooting Common Exchange Issues

results.description:
Social Media and other Digital trends are creating the New New PR. Find out how to

Harness this rapidly changing frontier to make the most noise

Create the greatest impact for your Startup if your social media presence is still lacking

Announce new products or changing service offerings leveraging social media

Orchestrate PR such it dovetails and accelerates your marketing and business development

We will be discussing what Specific Steps to take to get the best bang for your buck

Email the moderator with any particular questions you would like answered at the event at [masked]

Agenda:

6:00-6:15 PM Networking
6:15-7:00 PM Panel
7:00-7:30 PM Q & A between the panel/crowd
7:30-8 PM Networking

You can check out the Alley Boost: Startup PR Panel website for more details.

Moderator

Born in a corrugated iron hut in Bangladesh with no running water, Wazi came to America to study Electrical Engineering (Univ of Pennsylvania), Finance (Wharton), and an MBA (Stanford University). Working as an Investment Banker, Venture Capitalist and Management Consultant (The Boston Consulting Group) gave Wazi the tools to become an Entrepreneur – starting companies he has sold, run or folded.  

Wazi is Director of EntrepreneurshipEcosystemNYC: Startup Companies, Professionals and Students have the opportunity to Cross Learn at Mercy College’s Manhattan Campus. Wazi leverages these Capabilities to create High Growth Businesses for Clients focusing on BDSM: Business Development, Sales & Marketing.

Panelists

Brian Aitken, Founder & Chief Creative Strategist, Alister & Paine

Brian Aitken is a Webby Award nominated marketer, entrepreneur, and best-selling author. He received his Executive Education from the NYU Stern School of Business, was extended a scholarship to the Manchester Business School's Global MBA program for 'exceptional entrepreneurship', and is a regular guest at MIT's Initiative on the Digital Economy. Aitken presently serves on the Board of Directors for three companies–including Alister & Paine Magazine–and is the Managing Supervisor of Paid Media at Ketchum Digital where he oversees paid strategy for companies like Hewlett-Packard, ConAgra, and MasterCard.


Brian Braiker, Executive Editor, Digiday


Brian Braiker is the executive editor of Digiday, a website that charts the future of digital media and marketing. Previously he's been a staff writer for Newsweek, the Guardian and Rolling Stone, among others. His work has also appeared in The New York Times, Washington Post, People magazine, Adweek, Parenting, Variety and more. 

João-Pierre S. Ruth, New York Editor, Xconomy


After more than thirteen years as a business reporter in New Jersey, João-Pierre S. Ruth joined the ranks of Xconomy in 2011, first as a correspondent and then as editor for its New York City branch. Earlier in his career he covered telecom players such as Verizon Wireless and device makers such as Samsung. Now he can be found chatting up New York's dynamic startups and savvy investors.

Luis Navia, Director Innovation and Culture, Elite Daily

Luis is currently the Director Innovation and Culture at Elite Daily, a digital media publication with the staff being entirely comprised of millennials, including our 3,000+ contributors with an audience of 74M uniques. Our tagline, “The Voice of Generation-Y,” not only reflects our commitment to delivering content specifically targeted to Generation-Y, but also authentic content shaped by talented media professionals of the same demographic. He currently sits on the board of directors of AIESEC US, the largest international youth-led organization across 124 countries and territories.


Yannis Moati, Founder & CEO, Hotels by Day

Born in Tunisia to French and Italian parents, spent his childhood living in different countries & continents, leading him to master 5 different languages and forging a solidly independent character.

Entrepreneurship comes naturally to all independence seekers and was further honed-in when he later moved to the United States to pursue a higher education at Northeastern University in Boston. Post school, Yannis co-founded a company specialized in exotic travel, then managed a pioneering global Tour Operator company out of New York City.

It is while traveling extensively throughout Europe that Yannis first came across the concept of selling rooms for the day. Using un-committed inventory surely sounded genial for a hotel to boost its revenues. Coming back to the USA and adopting the clever concept of the sharing economy, Yannis surrounded himself with some of the most experienced professionals in the hospitality industry to form the project of HotelsByDay. 

Thank you to our sponsor!

Moisan Legal P.C. utilizes technology to foster a collaborative client/attorney interaction. Our goal is to be your ongoing strategic resource and enable your business to operate effectively.


Seagate is a well-established and reputable custom software R&D boutique from Israel. 

Sergata specializes in providing innovative web, desktop, and mobile high-end technologies and solutions for startups, entrepreneurs, and hi-tech companies, granting them with the technological peace of mind needed in order to focus on other aspects of their business.

Founded in 2006, Sergata's team has 80 full time, hand-picked, talented, and big-thinking software engineers, system analysts, quality assurance engineers, and project managers, who can face rapid development challenges, quickly adapting to changing needs.

Sergata’s experience in the field of entrepreneurship provides invaluable insights into the development process, a focus on the essentials, an understanding of the need for infrastructure that can be customized to user requirements and the tremendous importance of user interface design.

We embrace the agile methodologies along with the "Fail Fast" and MVP concepts together with the understanding of the limitations of our customers, their dynamic environment and the constant need for live progress monitoring and frequent deliveries. 

All sales are final

results.description:
George Popescu , together with our co-sponsors:  


Backed (https://www.backedinc.com/) 
District CoWork ( http://www.districtcowork.com/ ) 
Down the Road Brewery ( http://downtheroadbrewery.com/ ) 

will lead a discussion on "How to build a secondary market for p2p marketplace lending websites". 


---------------------

Agenda :

George Popescu, CEO, Backed ,  " How to build a secondary market for p2p marketplace lending websites"


Jeffrey M. Lewis , Senior Portofolio Manager TIG Securitized Asset Fund, "Secondary Market , Present and Future"  

Gregory J. Nowak, Partner Pepper Hamilton,"Legal aspects of a Secondary Market for Marketplace Lending "


I am working on inviting for talks a few industry leaders ( Orchard, Even Financial, FolioFN, Crowdnetic ...) to discuss this how-to .


Structure : I suggest 3 talks of 20 minutes each, with a 10 minutes Q&A in between. I will hold one of the talks.  

I am going to give a 20 min talk on how I would build it based on my experience with the currencies market at Boston Technologies (clearing, price, execution, business development, margin, regulatory...) and my experience with the marketplace lending space at Backed ( servicing, origination, underwriting, pricing, lending capital costs, regulatory, asset type...) 


If there is a lot of demand we can organize maybe a longer / 2nd event.


---------------------

George A. Popescu sold and exited Boston Technologies (BT) in 2014. BT is a technology company, inter-broker dealer, high frequency trading and other in the FX Spot, precious metals and CFDs space. I was the Founder and CEO of BT which I boot-strapped from $0 to a $20+ million business without any equity investment. BT has been #1 fastest growing company in Boston in 2011 according to the Boston Business Journal and the only company being in top 10 fastest in[masked] as it was #5 in 2012. BT has been on the Inc. 500/5000 list of fastest growing companies in the US for 4 years in a row ( #143, #373, #897 and #1270). After the exit and for a transition period I was employed as Head-of-Strategy for Currency Mountain ( www.currencymountain.com ), a USD 100 million+ holding company focused on retail and medium institutional currencies, fixed income and CFDs businesses.

Presently he is the co-CEO and co-founder of Backed , an online lending marketplace focused on co-signed personal unsecured loans. Simultaneously he is CEO of Down the Road Brewery, a craft beer brewery in Boston and Partner in LunaCap Ventures, a VC fund focused on venture debt to young companies with at least $100k in revenue. He is also President of Journal of Cellular and Molecular Medicine, a peer reviewed scientific journal with impact factor 5.  

--------------------

Jeffrey M. Lewis joined the Adviser in 2013 as a Senior Portfolio Manager for the TIG Securitized AssetFund. Mr. Lewis has more than 25 years’ experience investing and managing alternative, fixed income and derivative products. Prior to TIG, Mr. Lewis was most recently a Senior Managing Director at Guggenheim Partners, a diversified financial services firm. At Guggenheim, Mr. Lewis also served as Chairman and CEO of Generation Mortgage, Guggenheim’s reverse mortgage subsidiary. Prior to running Generation, Mr. Lewis was Co-Head of Guggenheim Capital Markets. Before joining Guggenheim in 2002, he served as Senior Vice President at York Capital Management, an event- driven hedge fund manager in New York. From 1990 to 1998, Mr. Lewis served as Managing Director of Donaldson, Lufkin and Jenrette (DLJ), where he founded and managed the Fixed Income Derivatives Group for DLJ. Also while at DLJ, Mr. Lewis managed the Mortgage Arbitrage Group and co-headed Residential Mortgage trading. From 1986- 1990 Mr. Lewis served as a Mortgage Securities Trader for Bankers Trust & Drexel Burnham. Mr. Lewis has both a BA in Government and an MBA in Finance from Cornell University.

-----------------------

Thanks,
George 
CEO 
Backed Inc

We hope you all had a fantastic summer. We've put together another great event based on your questions and feedback.  Check out the agenda below and be sure to get you RSVP in!

AGENDA

Bob Bishop is a partner in Goodwin Procter’s Technology Companies Group and is co-leader of the firm's FinTech Practice. He has more than 18 years’ experience representing emerging companies and venture capital and private equity firms. Bob is a key contributor to Goodwin Procter’s Founders Workbench, an online resource for start-ups, emerging companies and the entrepreneurial community, and is a co-leader of the firm’s FinTech practice initiative. Bob is also a member of the Board of Directors of the Fintech Sandbox, a Boston-based nonprofit whose mission is to promote entrepreneurship and innovation globally in the financial technology sector, as well as a member of the Board of Advisors of The Capital Network, a nonprofit that provides extensive educational programming and an engaged community to help early-stage entrepreneurs.

He focuses his practice on a sophisticated international client base comprised mainly of mid-sized asset management firms and the asset management divisions of large, diversified financial services companies.  He has deep experience and a broad range in managing legal issues and regulatory risks for his clients, including investment adviser issues, and actively teams with the firm’s tax, ERISA and other specialty groups to bring clients best-in-class service.

results.description:
On October 13th we are hosting a joint meetup with our friends at Empire Hacking. This will be held at WeWork Chelsea, rather than the usual location at the MongoDB offices.

Talk 1: The PointsTo Use-After-Free Detector

Abstract: PointsTo is an LLVM-based static analysis system that  automatically finds use-after-free vulnerabilities in large codebases. It employs a context- and flow-sensitive pointer alias analysis to determine where pointers point. This talk will discuss the design of PointsTo and its implementation in LLVM.

Speaker Bio: Peter Goodman is a dynamic binary translator.

Talk 2: Protecting Virtual Function Calls in COTS C++ Binaries

Abstract: Virtual function calls in C++ are a popular target for control subversion attacks.  Compilers utilize virtual tables (VTables) to accomplish virtual function calls. Given a C++ binary, vfGuard will (1) identify the virtual function callsites and (2) recover VTables in the program to provide a strict integrity policy. The policies constructed by vfGuard are sound and of significantly higher precision when compared to state-of-the-art binary-only control-flow integrity solutions.

Speaker Bio: Aravind Prakash earned a PhD from Syracuse University in May 2015 and is currently an assistant professor in the Dept. of CS at Binghamton University. His research focuses on program integrity models.

Beverages and light food will be provided. Space is limited, please RSVP. If you're interested in getting an office at a WeWork after visiting the event (which we recommend!), contact [masked].
results.name: Joint October C++ Meetup with Empire Hacking

In this workshop, you will explore what business development means for an early stage company, which is very different from the traditional approach. You'll be introduced to a multi-step process that will show you how to maximize your resources, find opportunities, close deals, and really create a long-term value for an organization from customers, markets, and relationships. At its heart, business development is about exploring how the interactions of those forces combine together to create opportunities for growth.

Led by Zoltan Szalas, Co-founder of Croissant, we will discuss how to succeed at every stage of the business development cycle, from outreach to developing and formalizing partnerships. Entrepreneurs, small business owners, sales professionals, and career changers will all benefit from a greater knowledge of business development skills.

This is the dish that sumo wrestlers consume in vast quantities to give them their girth and strength! You won't need to buy new pants before joining us and hopefully won't need to after either.
