results.description:
**Come any time between 6pm and 9pm, stay as long as you want, or leave when you need to. You will get your own check, with tax and tip included.**

Let’s welcome fall with a visit to a group favorite, Village Natural, a comfortable, casual, and homey veggie and vegan-friendly café in the West Village. Here, you can travel the globe by way of a varied selection of delicious (and colorful) dishes. Time Out New York calls the fare “cosmopolitan” and “diverse”, while New York magazine remarks, “No matter what you choose you can rely on its being good for you – it’s an all-natural feast.” (I’m a regular here, and can attest to the consistent and wholesome quality of the food.) Travel to Asia veggie-style with tofu teriyaki or curried udon noodles, or to Italy with spaghetti and wheat balls or veggie cutlet parmigiana. You can also take an gastronomic excursion south of the border with enchiladas, tostadas or fajitas, or to the Middle-East with Moroccan cous-cous. Sandwiches and veggie burgers are also available, as are freshly extracted juices, teas, organic wines and beers (I’m a fan of the Wolaver’s Pale Ale).

So come mingle with your fellow Vegetarian and Vegan Meetup friends! For those of you who have never attended one of our Meetup events, this is an incredibly friendly & welcoming group. It will be easy to find our group: we will have several large tables in the middle of the restaurant. (Most of the people in the restaurant will be us.) Everyone pays for themselves. Easy!

** You are welcome to show up anytime between 6:00 PM and 9:00 PM. You may stay the whole time, or feel free to leave whenever you need to. If the room gets crowded, we may ask people who have finished their meals to move to the bar for a little while. **

Train Directions: Village Natural is conveniently located near the W. 4th St. – Washington Square subway station (A, B, C, D, E, F and M trains), the 14th St. 1, 2 and 3 trains, and the 9th St. PATH station.

The restaurant has requested that everyone order an entree.  (Some of their customers recently have ordered just an appetizer, or just tea, which is difficult for their continued staying in business.)

See you there!

**Come any time between 6pm and 9pm, stay as long as you want, or leave when you need to. You will get your own check, with tax and tip included.**


- Leslie
results.how_to_find_us: You'll easily see our large group seated at several large tables in the center of the restaurant. And feel free to ask the waitstaff where the "Meetup" is.
results.name: Vegetarian/Vegan Dinner at Village Natural

results.description:
New York Startup Conference 

Sponsored by Microsoft, Rackspace, MicroFame Media and WeWork.

Being a successful entrepreneur and startup founder is hard work and requires understanding every aspect of building a company. At our conference we want to address this issue by helping you understand how a startup can use the cloud, strategic marketing tools and big data to make money. At our conference we will address 4 crucial verticals every startup should be aware of before even asking for money. 

We have four speakers each specializing in an area for this conference 

John Yi: Using the cloud to take your startup infrastructure to the next level 

Michael Schein: Getting your product off the ground with marketing

John Ortega: How natural language and software can be combined to learn about your users.

Maria Naggaga: How Microsoft services can help your startup. 


Speakers:
John Yi, Cloud Solutions Architect, Rackspace. John’s understanding of the Cloud as a great tool to facilitate automation has led him to Openstack and Rackspace. His current interests are in cloud architectures and IT infrastructure automation with different tools and services.

Michael Schein, CEO, MicroFame Media. Michael runs a content marketing and strategy agency that turns organizations into recognized authorities in their fields for the purpose of generating new business online. He has created or facilitated the production of content for companies such as eBay, LinkedIn, Abila, and TESLA.

John Ortega, Senior NLP Research Engineer, Nuance Communications, CEO and Founder, Vidpal and Computer Science (PhD) Universitat d’Alacant. John has been working in software engineering for over a decade focusing on precision and planning and is up to date in Big Data and Algorithmic Design.

Maria Naggaga, Technical Evangelist Microsoft. Maria works closely with the academic and startup communities. She volunteers with Young Game Makers and Black Girls Code as an instructor.

results.description:
Please note that we are not Squarespace employees, and this event is not endorsed by, sponsored by, or affiliated with, Squarespace.


--
This month’s special event is all about getting really good at finding, using and leveraging highly practical resources on the web that can help you take your web work to the next level in an instant. Website platforms (Squarespace), design assets, photography, illustration, video, plugins, templates, starting points, freebies, and much more. There are thousands of creative resources out there for you to use. Knowing what they are and how to find them will save you a great deal of time, money and frustration, and it's how you avoid reinventing the wheel.

Leave your computers at home and join us on our beautiful rooftop venue in Lower East Side. Squarespace Designer/Developer Jason Barone will take you through a visual presentation of how to leverage resources to create amazing web projects. We may have a guest speaker segment and we'll of course have Q&A. We’ll end the evening with some networking.

--
Agenda (subject to change):

5:20 - 6:00 – Check-in
6:00 - 6:30 – Web Design Hacking demo with Jason Barone
6:00 - 7:00 – Q&A 
7:00 - 8:00 – Networking, drinks until closing

--
Speakers:

Jason Barone - http://jasonbarone.com - Jason is a designer, developer and Squarespace expert who has been using Squarespace for over 8 years. He’s founder of Squarefront (http://squarefront.com), host of the Talk Squarespace chat community, and host of multiple podcasts including Talking Squarespace, and the Unauthorized Squarespace Show.

We may have a guest speaker segment.

--
Space is limited, so make sure to RSVP. Event will happen regardless of weather. We have indoor backup space.

Beer and wine are on us.

--
Location and Checkin:

Location will be shown to members only. 
Lower East Side, New York.
Building is locked so check-in starts at 5:20pm and doors close at 6:00pm. Someone from our team will be standing by door to check you in.

results.description:
Makey Makey Workshop:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rfQqh7iCcOU


What's MaKey MaKey?

MaKey MaKey is an invention kit for the 21st century. Turn everyday objects into touchpads and combine them with the internet. It's a simple Invention Kit for Beginners and Experts doing art, engineering, and everything inbetween:

Who is MaKey MaKey For?

Artists, Kids, Educators, Engineers, Designers, Inventors, Makers... Really it is for everyone.

How Does it Work?

Alligator Clip two objects to the MaKey MaKey board. For example, you and a banana.

When you touch the banana, you make a connection, and MaKey MaKey sends the computer a keyboard message. The computer just thinks MaKey MaKey is a regular keyboard (or mouse). Therefore it works with all programs and webpages, because all programs and webpages take keyboard and mouse input.

Make + Key = MaKey MaKey!

What materials work with MaKey Makey?

Any material that can conduct at least a tiny bit of electricity will work. Here are some materials people have used in our workshops including Ketchup, Pencil Graphite, Finger Paint, Lemons, etc.:

Other materials that work great: Plants, Coins, Your Grandma, Silverware, Anything that is Wet, Most Foods, Cats and Dogs, Aluminum Foil, Rain, and hundreds more…

Why Are You Creating MaKey MaKey?

We believe that everyone is creative, inventive, and imaginative. We believe that everyone can create the future and change the world. So we have dedicated our lives to making easy-to-use invention kits. We believe that the whole world is a construction kit, if we choose to see it that way.

We are inspired by the Maker Movement. We want to help people start to think of themselves as Makers and agents of change. When you have the "Maker's Mindset," you know you can change the world.


This workshop will include building your own makey makey circuit, using it to make a sing, play a game or create anything you want using the awesome interaction of the makey makey.


To learn more and take a look at projects and possible ideas, check out

www.makeymakey.com

or Youtube.com

results.description:
Note: This is a cultural event, not a social gathering like our monthly meeting. 


Seats are limited and your seat is not guaranteed unless you RSVP to the sponsor directly (see contact below) and get a positive response from them. 

In other words:

Step 1: Click the RSVP button here in the group.

Step 2: Send e-mail to [masked] with your first & last name.


What is it?

Deutsches Haus at NYU and the German University Alliance present a Talk by Professor Rolf-Peter Janz who will speak on "Laughter–Promoted and Verboten. With Particular Reference to Nietzsche, Heine, and Kafka."

Rolf-Peter Janz is professor emeritus in the German Department of Freie Universität Berlin. His scholarship covers the literature and aesthetics of Classicism and Romanticism, Fin de Siècle Vienna, and the Weimar Republic, as well as the reshaping of Greek myths in 20th-century literature. 

His current research focuses on the connection between the sublime and the ridiculous, and on text-image relations.

More info here: http://deutscheshaus.as.nyu.edu/object/io_1439309000055.html

The act will be a healthy mix of philosophy and comedy, performed in English.

Who is hosting the event?

Deutsches Haus @ NYU is the host for this event.  They have staff members on site. 

How do I get there?

N/R - 8th St NYU (3 Blocks)

6 - Astor Place (4 blocks)

B/D/F/M - West 4th St (5-8 Blocks)

Is there a bar / food  available?

No. This is a cultural performance.

How do I register or reserve a seat?

While the event is free, advance registration with the host is required. Please register ASAP by e-mailing [masked] in order to reserve your spot. They will need your first & last name as well as the date of the event to put you on the attendee list.

Why do I have to RSVP twice?

We are trying to add value to the group by offering additional events related to the German culture and language. As we are in the trial phase we are gauging the interest in the group for certain things like concerts, exhibits, and other events. The hosts/organizers/sponsors of those events are not necessarily associated with meetup or our group and therefor have their own RSVP procedures in place which we must follow in order to participate.

Please only RSVP if you mean it and update it if your plans change. It helps more than you might think and is highly appreciated. Thank you!

Thomas

[masked]

[masked]

results.description:
Register here:http://beginnerprogrammers.nyc/full-stack-bootcamp/


Overview:


Become a full stack developer who understands the power of the HTML while being able to control and create robust Ruby on Rails applications. Take This Course, and you will enjoy a 12 week bootcamp where you will leave with several web apps and critical thinking skills.

Our Structure:


Students will attend class 3 times weekly while being given homework assignments and projects to work on outside of class. You will also have direct communication with each of your instructors and TA’s before, during, and after the bootcamp completes.


Our weekend Peer Programming events are also a great way to sharpen your programming skills and complete assignments amongst fellow coders.


Class Setup:


The best educations come from small class sizes and direct instruction, period. You will be part of a class no larger than 10 students.


Preparing You for the Real World:


Select students will be given immediate internship opportunities as an Rails developer with some of the startups that we work with. During the final month of the boot camp, each student will spend time shadowing a developer at a tech startup to gain experience and interact with an actual developer.


We will also refer you to available positions through our extensive network after teaching you vital interviewing skills needed to be a self sufficient developer.


Pre-requisites:

No previous programming experience is required, but we would recommend you at least take one of our free appetizer courses on www.beginnerprogrammers.nyc

Please bring a laptop capable of running either Linux or Mac-OSX

Install Ruby and Rails 4. (Send an email if you need help with this step.)

Install Sublime Text:  http://www.sublimetext.com/


Instructor: Alain Goldman

Ruby on Rails Developer @ www.lootfly.com

CTO of Beginner Programmers: www.beginnerprogrammers.nyc

Organizer of: http://www.meetup.com/BeginnerProgrammers/

Email: [masked]

Cost: $2500 (email us for available financing/payment plans)

Start Date: October 13th - December 30th

Schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs 6:30pm - 8:30pm 

Location: ReadyWork 239 W 29th st #603 New York, NY 10036


For questions regarding this bootcamp, please contact Alain Goldman at [masked]

results.description:
This is such a fun wine tasting and sells out every time! If you are new to wine or a die hard fan, it's a great experience for all! Walk table to table at your own pace to sample each wine. 

You will get a wine glass that you can have filled as many times as you'd like.  There are 3 tables or stations where they will be pouring the wines and explaining each one.  There is also a table full of appetizers! 

Socialize and network in a relaxed atmosphere during one of our very popular walk around wine tasting events. Unlike other wine tastings where you are stuck at one table, this walk around format gives you the opportunity to easily meet other members and wine enthusiasts.  

You will enjoy up to 24 different wines all carefully explained by Vinoversity’s friendly and knowledgeable sommeliers. Tickets are just $29 (will go up to $35 as event gets closer).  

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (limited space and no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Oct-13-2015_at_0630PM

What kinds of wine/apps?  24 whites, reds, sparklers, rose's, & dessert wines. These wines will not disappoint, and will amaze you with their unique flavors, styles, and mineralities. A super tasting from an incredible wine region! Complimentary cheeses, dips, olives, & flatbreads will be served. 

Can I come alone?  Yes 90%  attending come on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work.  It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? This is a multi-Meetup event so don't just go by RSVP's here. There will be 40+ others there.

What are the ages?  This is non-age specific event.  We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance?  Yes.  Space is limited. This a Prepay Only Event. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Oct-13-2015_at_0630PM
results.name: Wine Tasting Social - Enjoy 24 Wines + Light Apps (PREPAY ONLY EVENT)

results.description:
About the Event:

The Code for America summit (#CfASummit) is an annual collection of smart government and civic technology practitioners. For this BetaTalk, we have invited NYC’s & New Jersey's #CfASummit attendees to share their insights, highlights, and reinforce the local connections made on that other coast. You will get the "Best of CfASummit" even if you could not make the trip.


For this night, eight to ten Code for America Summit speakers and attendees will recap their personal highlights and reconnect the discussions to the work our community's doing locally.


If you attended CfA Summit and we haven't already reached out to you, let us know!


With the support of the Internet Society of New York, we will attempt to live stream the event. You can tune in via livestream.com/internetsociety.

2015 CfA Summit Videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL65XgbSILalUZFyWsZqbtZKN1iffAOM5M

BetaNYC's 2014 CfA Summit Recap: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Nf6J6ohz37U 

CfA Summit Tweets: https://twitter.com/hashtag/CfASummit


-=-

Venue notes:

1. Space is very limited. If you can't attend, please respect the RSVP list. Seating will be first come, first served. 


-=-

Schedule:

6:30 - Doors open, drinks and mingling


7:00 - Event starts

7:15 - Sharebacks from #CfASummit attendants

8:15 - Closing insights and questions

-=-

About our sponsor - Microsoft Technology & Civic Engagement

Microsoft Technology & Civic Innovation partners with a wide range of local community stakeholders, including Code for America and BetaNYC, as well as governments, non-profits, businesses, startups, think tanks, academic institutions, and grassroots civic hackers. Working with these groups, we aim to collaboratively address the most pressing community challenges through the hyper-local creation, deployment, and evangelism of civic technology.  Our areas of focus include data and privacy, 21st century jobs and opportunities, and more responsive and resilient communities.

About our media partner - Internet Society 

The Internet Society is an independent international nonprofit organisation founded in 1992 to provide leadership in Internet related standards, education, and policy around the world. In keeping with our motto 'The Internet is for Everyone', we work to ensure that the Internet - and the web that is built on it - continues to develop as an open platform that empowers people to share ideas and connect in new and innovative ways, and serves the economic, social, and educational needs of all.​

About our event partner - Code for Jersey City

Code for Jersey City is a nonpartisan, civic-tech, volunteer community group that collaborates with local government and community partners.  We build new tools that help with local civic issues, advocate for better technology and open government, and provide a space for residents to voice and act on their ideas so that our city can grow for, and by the people. We use open data, user research and other metrics to visualize trends to support our city. We offer innovative ways to use the web and mobile software in government operations and community outreach for residents to be informed and empowered.

results.name: BetaTalk - Best of Code for America Summit (#CfASummit) 2015

Experience a Bollywood-inspired dance-fitness program that combines exhilarating choreography and intensive workouts with upbeat music from around the world.

Price: $20/single class or package. Please register for classes on BOLLYX.com.

About the instructor:

Minal Mehta is the Co-Founder and President of BOLLYX. She has a fitness background in competitive synchronized swimming, water polo and swimming, and an artistic background in various styles of dance, including Bollywood, Kathak, jazz, Indian folk, and hip hop. Minal was at the forefront of Bollywood dance exploding in collegiate competitions nationwide, leading her UC Berkeley Bollywood dance team (Aao Na) to sweep all national competitions in 2005. Minal is an AFAA certified group fitness instructor and teaches BOLLYX classes in NYC.  Minal graduated from UC Berkeley in 2005 with a B.A. in Economics with Honors and from Harvard Business School in 2011 with an M.B.A in general management.

results.description:
We are extremely excited to introduce you to our newest sponsor - Giovanni Rana Pasta Kitchen, a rustic Italian restaurant in Chelsea Market where fresh pasta is made on site daily in it’s Pasta Studio, and hand-selected rare and regional Italian products and prepared foods are available to take home.

Come out and mingle with other women in B2B marketing for a short (and super fun) pasta making class, coupled with plenty of wine tasting and networking. This is certainly going to be a meetup you won't want to miss!

Special thank you to Brooke Madden, one of our fellow M2M members, for making this event possible.
results.name: Wine, Pasta Making & Marketing: October Meetup

results.description:
How do the wisdom of the ages and the world of work inform each other? What is the fundamental ground of work that supports the full flowering of individuals, groups, and society as a whole? As conscious business people, what can we create together that we can not create alone?

Please join us at this new meetup to discover the answers to these questions, and to co-create a space where new possibilities and collaboration can arise.
results.name: Kickoff meeting

group.name: New York Metro Conscious Business Meetup

results.description: The North Face has joined the free fitness movement with the Mountain Athletics program. The MA Crew meets every Tuesday and Thursday night at 6:30pm for an hour of boot camp style workouts aimed to prepare you to achieve your outdoor goal. The workouts focus on strength, work capacity, and plyometric agility (making it a great source for cross training!). Each session is led by two of The North Face pro trainers and is attended by goal oriented local athletes. FREE and open to all levels. Don't miss out! bit.ly/tues_ma_nyc
results.how_to_find_us: We meet at the fountain. Look for the Train With Us flag!
results.name: Workout FREE with The North Face

results.description:
This is such a fun wine tasting and sells out every time! If you are new to wine or a die hard fan, it's a great experience for all! Walk table to table at your own pace to sample each wine. 

You will get a wine glass that you can have filled as many times as you'd like.  There are 3 tables or stations where they will be pouring the wines and explaining each one.  There is also a table full of appetizers! 

Socialize and network in a relaxed atmosphere during one of our very popular walk around wine tasting events. Unlike other wine tastings where you are stuck at one table, this walk around format gives you the opportunity to easily meet other members and wine enthusiasts.  

You will enjoy up to 24 different wines all carefully explained by Vinoversity’s friendly and knowledgeable sommeliers. Tickets are just $29 (will go up to $35 as event gets closer).  

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (limited space and no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Oct-13-2015_at_0630PM

What kinds of wine/apps?  24 whites, reds, sparklers, rose's, & dessert wines. These wines will not disappoint, and will amaze you with their unique flavors, styles, and mineralities. A super tasting from an incredible wine region! Complimentary cheeses, dips, olives, & flatbreads will be served. 

Can I come alone?  Yes 90%  attending come on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work.  It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? This is a multi-Meetup event so don't just go by RSVP's here. There will be 40+ others there.

What are the ages?  This is non-age specific event.  We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance?  Yes.  Space is limited. This a Prepay Only Event. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Oct-13-2015_at_0630PM
results.name: Wine Tasting Social - Enjoy 24 Wines + Light Apps (PREPAY ONLY EVENT)

This is such a fun wine tasting and sells out every time! If you are new to wine or a die hard fan, it's a great experience for all! Walk table to table at your own pace to sample each wine. 

You will get a wine glass that you can have filled as many times as you'd like.  There are 3 tables or stations where they will be pouring the wines and explaining each one.  There is also a table full of appetizers! 

Socialize and network in a relaxed atmosphere during one of our very popular walk around wine tasting events. Unlike other wine tastings where you are stuck at one table, this walk around format gives you the opportunity to easily meet other members and wine enthusiasts.  

You will enjoy up to 24 different wines all carefully explained by Vinoversity’s friendly and knowledgeable sommeliers. Tickets are just $29 (will go up to $35 as event gets closer).  

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (limited space and no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Oct-13-2015_at_0630PM

What kinds of wine/apps?  24 whites, reds, sparklers, rose's, & dessert wines. These wines will not disappoint, and will amaze you with their unique flavors, styles, and mineralities. A super tasting from an incredible wine region! Complimentary cheeses, dips, olives, & flatbreads will be served. 

Can I come alone?  Yes 90%  attending come on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work.  It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? This is a multi-Meetup event so don't just go by RSVP's here. There will be 40+ others there.

What are the ages?  This is non-age specific event.  We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance?  Yes.  Space is limited. This a Prepay Only Event. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Oct-13-2015_at_0630PM
results.name: Wine Tasting Social - Enjoy 24 Wines + Light Apps (PREPAY ONLY EVENT)

venue.name: New York Society For Ethical Culture

results.description:
Neuro...what? Whoa! Yet another type of sexism?! Like we didn't have enough with 'hostile sexism' and its more subtle chum – hidden-part-of-the-iceberg sexism, aka 'benevolent sexism'! Human brains sure know creativity... even for the production of biases (because why not?) — in every way, shape or form, it seems.

Ok, so what does this term 'NEUROSEXISM' refer to exactly? What is implied here: errors of reasoning, of interpretation? And by whom? 

Further, what are its impacts or consequences? 

- How is this harmful and to whom?

- How skeptical do we get? How can we tell science apart from pseudoscience? 

- What do we really know, at this point in time, about human brains with respect to sex/gender similarities or differences? What is confirmed, invalidated, pure myth, still being researched?

- What implications for Feminism? For the ongoing 'nature and nurture' debate?

As always, listed below, are some materials that may be of interest. These are not required for the meetup. They are simply resources you may enjoy.

-----

ARTICLES

·  'Neurosexism' – an overview: Neurosexism: Brains, Gender and Tech

·  'Neurosexism' – now what? (some thoughts on its impacts and what to do next…)

“Brain Study Confirms Gender Stereotypes”: How science communication can fuel modern sexism and Neurosexism: A conversation with Cordelia Fine

·  Just for fun (the writing is amusing) So my mushy head is 'hardwired' for girly things, is it? If this is science, I am Richard Dawkins

-----

VIDEO

· Sex, Brain, and Culture: The Science and Pseudoscience of Gender Difference (OUTSTANDING lecture by Lise ELIOT, at the University of Texas – "Center for Values in Medicine, Science, and Technology")

-----

PODCAST

· "Rationally Speaking" – Episode 30 (Julia GALEF and Massimo PIGLIUCCI talk with Cordelia FINE, author of "Delusions of Gender")

-----

BEYOND – Scholarly links, if you just cannot get enough on the topic! ;)

· Recommendations for sex/gender neuroimaging research: key principles and implications for research design, analysis, and interpretation

· Neurofeminism and feminist neurosciences: a critical review of contemporary brain research
results.name: 'Neurosexism' / Debunking Pseudoscience and Myths around the 'Gendered Brain'

results.description:
Class Tuesday night 6:30-8:30pm.
Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.
Everyone is welcome!
results.name: Intercambio - Spanish/English language exchange!!

The new and fun way to find your new roommate. Whether you want to meet some people to find a new place with, or if you have a spare room you'd like to fill, this is a fun and social way to get it done.

Why sort through hundreds of e-mails to set up roommate interviews, only to get rejected?

Why spend an entire weekend letting strangers into your house?

It's a casual and fun event that allows you to have a drink with potential roommates and see if there is any roommate chemistry brewing. Best of all, there is no charge to come to the event. Yes, it's FREE.

132 West 47th Street, New York, NY 10036 

  “It’s better to light one candle than to curse the darkness.”

How do your actions effect the environment? Join us for Green Drinks October 13th and find out more about the upcoming documentary Racing Extinction that follows a team of conservationist and their efforts to quell the illegal wildlife trade and to educate individuals about how their actions directly effect the environment and the mass species loss we are facing. 

Megan Ryan from the film's marketing team will be at Green Drinks to talk a little about the film and promote the film's committment drive! Exposing the hidden world of extinction through never-before-seen images, the new film Racing Extinction, a documentary by Louie Psihoyos, the Academy Award winning director of The Cove will be opening September 18th at the Sunshine Village East before premiering on Discovery networks in December.

results.description:
Please note that due to construction you will need to use the alternate entrance located at 34 West 24th St.

We are sharing our love and knowledge of Scala and bringing it to a wider audience... YOU!

Come prepared with your laptop and install JDK, SBT, and IDE (Eclipse or IntelliJ) and create your first worksheet  https://gist.github.com/dspeele/79a7a4c78f4c040084fb

Brendan McAdams works as a Senior Consultant & Trainer for BoldRadius where he uses his expertise to help customers find success through consulting and training on the Typesafe Reactive Platform. With over 15 years of software development experience, Brendan boasts an impressive resume that most recently saw him work at Netflix building APIs for managing their devices. Prior to that, he worked as a consultant and trainer at Typesafe, and was an early employee of MongoDB, where he created the integration drivers between MongoDB and Scala, and MongoDB and Hadoop.


Brendan is a renowned speaker and luminary in the Scala community, and is a regular presenter at industry leading conferences such as Scala Days and Scala eXchange. His deep technical knowledge coupled with his outgoing and approachable personality not only make him a great speaker, but also a phenomenal trainer on the Typesafe Reactive Platform. 

Born in Philadelphia, Brendan spent some time living in New York City and London before making his way to the San Francisco Bay Area, which he now calls home. In his spare time, Brendan does a lot of open source work, enjoys biking and hiking in the Bay Area, is an avid hockey player, and a die hard enthusiast of Dwarf Fortress.
results.name: Scalaz - Gateway - Drugs “Workshop Presentation”

results.description:
Speaker: James Bach
"Is This Output Accurate? An example of 3 hours of deep testing"

Too often in talks about testing there is very little talk about testing. That's because it's not easy to talk about it. The true nature of testing is hard to speak. Many people feel as if it's so artful or mysterious that it's pointless to discuss details. I say nay. I say we can talk about it... but it takes practice to get good at it. In this talk I will get more practice talking about the fine details of deep testing, and you will be the judge of how obscure and mysterious it is. 

The substance of the testing I did was three hours carefully analyzing the accuracy of a particular kind of chart. I used mathematics and tools in reasonable ways to fulfill my mission. This culminated in two conclusions: 1) the chart is accurate enough. 2) well, I'm a little embarrassed about my second conclusion, so you will have to come and see what it is for yourself.


James Bach is a consulting software tester and author of Lessons Learned in Software Testing, as well as Secrets of a Buccaneer-Scholar. A founder of the Context-Driven Testing movement, he created Rapid Software Testing methodology and teaches it around the world.

Agenda
6:30 Refreshments 
7:00 Welcome and Announcements
7:10 James Bach
8:30 Testing Topics "Lean Coffee" Style
results.how_to_find_us: (between 47 and 48)
results.name: October Testers Meetup with James Bach

results.description:
Please RSVP with your first and last name and bring an ID. Thanks!

Code for JC has made a change to the October 13 Meetup due to an incredible Microsoft sponsorship opportunity to partner with BetaNYC and host a 'viewing' of the "Best of Code for America Summit 2015". 

We will reschedule the originally planned session with Brian Platt, Director of the Department of Innovation to demo a sneak peak of the City of Jersey City's Open Data Portal: http://data.jerseycitynj.gov. The new date will Tuesday, October 27 at 7:30pm (Location TBD).

We are in the process of migrating from Meetup to MailChimp as our email communication tool. So please accept our apologies if you are getting this email twice.

We hope to see you at the event on October 13. If you haven't already, this is your chance to meet the Microsoft Executive Team!

Best,
Code for JC's Leadership Team

About the Event:

The Code for America summit (#CfASummit) is an annual collection of smart government and civic technology practitioners. For this Code for JC and BetaTalk, we have invited NJ's and NYC’s #CfASummit attendees to share their insights, highlights, and reinforce the local connections made on that other coast. You'll get the "Best of CfASummit" even if you couldn't make the trip. 

For this night, eight to ten Code for America Summit speakers and attendees will recap their personal highlights and reconnect the discussions to the work our community's doing locally. 

If you attended CfA Summit and we haven't already reached out to you, let us know! 

With the support of the Internet Society of New York, we will attempt to live stream the event. You can tune in via livestream.com/internetsociety.

2015 CfA Summit Videos:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL65XgbSILalUZFyWsZqbtZKN1iffAOM5M

BetaNYC's 2014 CfA Summit Recap: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Nf6J6ohz37U 

CfA Summit Tweets: 
https://twitter.com/hashtag/CfASummit


-=-

Venue notes:

1. Space is very limited. If you can't attend, please respect the RSVP list. Seating will be first come, first served. 


-=-

Schedule:

6:30 - Doors open, drinks and mingling 

7:00 - Event starts 

7:15 - Sharebacks from #CfASummit attendants

8:15 - Closing insights and questions

-=-

About our co-sponsor - Microsoft Technology & Civic Engagement 

Microsoft Technology & Civic Innovation partners with a wide range of local community stakeholders, including Code for America, BetaNYC and Code for JC, as well as governments, non-profits, businesses, startups, think tanks, academic institutions, and grassroots civic hackers. Working with these groups, we aim to collaboratively address the most pressing community challenges through the hyper-local creation, deployment, and evangelism of civic technology.  Our areas of focus include data and privacy, 21st century jobs and opportunities, and more responsive and resilient communities.

About our media partner - Internet Society 

The Internet Society is an independent international nonprofit organization founded in 1992 to provide leadership in Internet related standards, education, and policy around the world. In keeping with our motto 'The Internet is for Everyone', we work to ensure that the Internet - and the web that is built on it - continues to develop as an open platform that empowers people to share ideas and connect in new and innovative ways, and serves the economic, social, and educational needs of all.​
results.how_to_find_us: www.codeforjc.org
results.name: Join the Best of Code for America Summit 2015 From Within Our Backyard!

results.description:
Register here: http://beginnerprogrammers.nyc/android-bootcamp/

Overview


Ever wanted to dive into the world of mobile development, or just make that app idea you're always telling your friends about? Take this 12 week bootcamp and we will explore the inner workings of the Android SDK. You will get a solid foundation of Java, the language of choice for Android. So that by the end of the course you will build a complete functioning Android Application ready for submission into the Google Play Store. So Take This Class, and enjoy changing your life!

Our Structure


Students will attend class 3 times weekly, (Mon, Tues,Thurs) from 6:30pm - 8:30pm, while being given homework assignments and projects to work on outside of class. You will also have direct communication with each of your instructors and TA’s before, during, and after the bootcamp completes.


Our weekend Peer Programming events are also a great way to sharpen your programming skills and complete assignments amongst fellow coders.


Class Setup


The best educations come from small class sizes and direct instruction...period. You will be part of a class no larger than 10 students.


Preparing You for the Real World


Select students will be given immediate internship opportunities as an Android developer with some of the startups that we work with. During the final month of the boot camp, each student will spend time shadowing a developer at a tech startup to gain experience and interact with an actual developer.


We will also refer you to available positions through our extensive network after teaching you vital interviewing skills needed to be a self sufficient developer.

Pre-requisites

• No previous programming experience is required, but we would recommend you at least take one of our free appetizer courses on www.beginnerprogrammers.nyc

Please bring a laptop capable of running

IntelliJ

and  

Android Studio

Instructor: Bryan Okeke

Android Developer @ www.bytemark.co

Founder of Beginner Programmers: www.beginnerprogrammers.nyc

Organizer of: http://www.meetup.com/BeginnerProgrammers/

Email: [masked]

Cost: $2500 (email us for available financing/payment plans)

Start Date: October 13th - December 30th

Schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs 6:30pm - 8:30pm


Register here: http://beginnerprogrammers.nyc/android-bootcamp/


For questions regarding this bootcamp, please contact Bryan Okeke at [masked]

results.description:
Everyone starts with a simple one-machine setup, running PHP (or whatever else you fancy), MySQL/PostgreSql and Apache/Nginx. Sooner or later that will not be enough, you will have more operations to do than can be done in a single request, or you will have some operations that need to be done in parallel and you will be faced with some important architecture decisions. This talk will show you how a distributed system built with gearman looks like, and more importantly the strange and wonderful things you will encounter in production and how to prepare for them.

=====

Srdjan Vranac is a developer, consultant, mercenary (used to be known as freelancing). He leads a small team that works on various projects ranging from small family businesses to Fortune 500 companies. He writes terrible code that performs exceptionally and currently wrangles elePHPants and Pythons.... His interests include process automation, continuous integration and delivery, clean code, testing, best practices (you have to know them so you can break them if you have to) and distributed systems.
results.name: Shifting Gears with Gearman - Srdjan Vranac

results.description:
Want to make comics but you're feeling stuck? Need supportive comics artists to hold you accountable for your progress? You did InkTober or 30 Days of Comics and realized you need that extra push to crank pages out? Want to draw in the company of other human beings?

THIS IS THE MEETUP FOR YOU. We'll be tackling questions like: Are you drawing comics? When are you going to draw comics? Why aren't you drawing comics right this moment? And so on and so forth. The answer to all these questions is: SHUT UP AND DRAW COMICS.

Drop on by, bring a friend, grab a beer or coffee, say hello, chat if you want, but DRAW COMICS.

We have a monthly meet and greet hangout meetup, and we also schedule drawing days, sketch days, convention visits, museum trips, whatever. If you have an idea for a meetup or a location you'd like to suggest, let me know!

For everyone who's been coming regularly, THANK YOU!! And newcomers - please feel free to come and join. Our group is diverse, energizing, and judgment-free. Finally, we would like to humbly ask that you consider pitching in $1 or $2 (only if you come a second+ time - not for newcomers) - it helps leverage the monthly Meetup website payment.

If you RSVP to a meetup but something comes up and you can't make it (and these things happen), please update your RSVP.

results.description:
The Internet of Things (IoT) is a hotly anticipated industry which has seen rapid growth in the past few years. According to a recent report from International Data Corporation (IDC), the IoT market is projected to grow from $655.8 billion in 2014 to $1.7 trillion in 2020. To highlight this growing industry, Tech in Motion New York will be hosting an IoT themed Panel Discussion on Tuesday, October 13th from 6:30pm-9:00pm at the historical Verizon Building. This event will specifically spotlight individuals local to the NYC tech scene, who are furthering the IoT concept and greater industry as a whole.

Our IoT Panel Discussion will be held at the historical landmark Verizon Building, which is on 140 West Street, New York, NY and is steps away from the World Trade Center. Join us for an evening of networking, discussion, Q&A and a few drinks.

Panelists:

Ed Maguire -- Senior Analyst & Managing Director at CLSA Americas

Ed Maguire is senior analyst and managing director at CLSA Americas covering the software industry, technology and innovation. Prior roles include president of strategic consultancy firm MAGNet Strategies, director at Merrill Lynch Technology Investment Banking, senior director at Merrill Lynch Equity Research and research associate at CIBC World Markets. Prior to Wall Street, he was senior sales manager for Twinbrook Music Distribution and worked extensively performing and recording as a professional musician. Ed holds a BA in music from Columbia University and an MBA in finance and management information systems from Rutgers Business School. He is widely quoted in financial media and has appeared on CNBC, Bloomberg TV, CNN, Fox Business News, BNN, NPR and other media.

Jamyn Edis -- Founder & CEO of Dash

Jamyn Edis is the founder and CEO of Dash, a connected car platform (www.dashmobile.co). Jamyn is also a mentor and investor in Techstars, the world’s premier technology accelerator, as well as being a participant in the New York 2013 program.

He has over 15 years of experience in strategy, product development, partnerships, finance and marketing.

As a VP at HBO, he led the Emerging Technology R&D Group and also worked in the London and New York offices at Accenture’s strategy consulting practice, with industry focus was technology, media and telecoms; his clients include Sprint, BT, Fox Interactive, MySpace, Rogers, Global Telematics, Trader.com, Sony PlayStation, World Rally Championships, Warner Music, EMI.

He is currently a Professor in New Media and Entrepreneur-in-Residence at NYU Stern School of Business. He holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA/MA from Cambridge University.


Ted Ullrich -- Founder of Tomorrow Lab

Ted is the Founder of Tomorrow Lab, an internationally recognized product design and engineering studio based in New York City. Tomorrow Lab develops smart hardware products for a better tomorrow. Ted believes the combination of science and design can allow small startup teams to develop new technology products that solve big problems.

Ted holds a Masters of Industrial Design from Georgia Tech, a Bachelors of Inventive Design Engineering from Purdue University, and has taught design studio courses at Drexel University in Philadelphia, the Georgia Institute of Technology, and the Copenhagen Institute of Interaction Design in Denmark.

Thomas Gilley -- Founder & CTO of wot.io

Thomas Gilley is is the Founder & CTO of wot.io. Tom is an entrepreneur and hands-on technologist, who has founded several successful technology companies.

Tom is a passionate entrepreneur with a breadth of experience working with mobile technologies, digital media, Internet of Things (IoT), and social computing. He served at Apple Computer in the Advanced Technology Group and Portable Products Group. Before and after his time at Apple, Tom founded several successful companies, including PicoStar, a Silicon Valley incubator-technology investment company. In 2008 he sold his on-demand Web media company to Vignette and acted as CTO throughout the transaction and through the company’s ultimate acquisition by OpenText. After traveling eastward, Tom served as a strategic adviser, investor, and technology company founder in New York City. In 2014 Tom founded wot.io, a data service exchange for connected device platforms.

</a>


--

As always we would like to thank our sponsors<a href="http://www.workbridgeassociates.com/locations/new-york"> Workbridge Associates, Jobspring Partners and Verizon for sponsoring this month’s event.

Also big thanks to Dyckman Beer Co. for generously providing beverages for this event.   


--

More about Verizon:

Verizon delivers the promise of the digital world.  At the center of today’s connected world, we work independently and with tech industry partners to put simple, yet incredibly powerful digital tools in the hands of our customers. With the nation’s most advanced and reliable 4G LTE mobile networks and FiOS fiber-optic, Verizon’s customers enjoy the benefits of the digital lifestyle, while we provide the communities we serve with new ways to prosper and grow in the Internet Age – connecting them to the global economy, expanding access to opportunity, and offering new approaches to the challenges of health care, education and environmental sustainability.

More about Grind

Grind is a premium operator of members-only collaborative workspaces designed for 'people who would rather work in a community than at a company'. Grind is a professional platform designed to fuel the leap from traditional corporate environments to 'the future of work' by offering not only flexible, beautiful spaces, but also communities of like-minded, hard working entrepreneurs who can share advice and expertise to enhance opportunities.

Grind +Verizon generously provides funding and support for the Tech in Motion events 


--

Want to learn more about Tech in Motion?

•  Visit TechinMotionEvents.com

• "Like" us on Facebook!

• Join the conversation on Twitter! Share and follow along with@Tech_in_Motion

• Check out our Tech Job Board

• Read insightful content from our speakers across the country onour blog

• Want to sign up for our email list? Click Here!

• Interested in sponsoring a Tech in Motion event? Click Here!

results.description:
The concept of chakra originates in Hindu texts and features in tantric and yogic traditions of Hinduism and Buddhism. Its name derives from the Sanskrit word for "wheel" or "turning" (cakraṃ चक्रं [ˈtʃəkrə̃], pronounced [ˈtʃəkrə] in Hindi; Pali: cakka चक्क, Thai: จักระ, Telugu: చక్రo, Tamil: சக்கரம், Kannada: ಚಕ್ರ, Chinese: 轮, Tibetan: འཁོར་ལོ་; khorlo).[1]

The chakras are believed to be a number of wheel-like vortices which, according to traditional Indian medicine, exist in the surface of the subtle body of living beings.[2] The chakras are said to be "force centers" or whorls of energy permeating, from a point on the physical body, the layers of the subtle bodies in an ever-increasing fan-shaped formation. Rotating vortices of subtle matter, they are considered focal points for the reception and transmission of energies.[3] Different belief systems posit a varying number of chakras; the best-known system in the West has seven chakras.

Learn how easy it can be to incorporate Off-Camera Flash into your natural light work flow to create images that wow your clients, differentiate you from the competition and make you more money. 

Off-Camera Flash Made Easy will include:

Using Off-Camera Flash shouldn’t be scary. Learn the basics behind Off-Camera Flash from a primary natural light photographer. Learn how easy it can be to incorporate Off-Camera Flash into your natural light work flow to create images that wow your clients, differentiate you from the competition and make you more money. Off-Camera Flash Made Easy will include a lecture, model, demonstration and hands on learning.

Vanessa Joy has been an influential photographer in the photographic community for years. Starting her photographic journey in 1998, she has since earned five college degrees, started her own business in 2008, and began teaching around the world in 2009. Vanessa had spoken at almost every major convention and platform in the industry such as CreativeLIVE, Clickin’ Moms, WPPI, ShutterFest, Imaging USA, PPA related conventions and personal workshops and numerous conventions around the globe. results.description:
This week I am going to see Pan I will arrive at 6:45 for the 7:20 pm showing. I  have seats E10 and E11 If you are coming post your seat #

Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Fri/Sat) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to drive there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!!    Love, Cassie

PS: I am doing this with my friendship group too so if you are S&L do wear your wristbands. If you need to buy one let me know, they are just $1 These are loads of fun at the movies though they glow in the dark!

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

"Launch Your Life! It's Not Rocket Science"

How do you go from being a farmer in New York, surrounded by nature...to one of NASA's top Flight Controllers, responsible for the lives and safety of the US astronauts aboard the international Space System? Joe Koronowski knows and he'll share how when you shoot for the stars...they're not as far away as you might think. 

Join us and find out how surprisingly simple it is to have whatever you want. After all, it's not rocket science. If Joe can do it...you can, too!

Joe Koronowski - Former NASA Rocket Scientist & Professional Speaker

https://youtu.be/siMwr735OS8

When it comes to the art of "re-invention," Joe Koronowski is a true master of transformation. He's been a farmer, engineer, solar race car builder/driver, amateur body builder, custom furniture builder, and an elite NASA Flight Controller for the International Space Station. Now he's a professional speaker who teaches other people how to Launch Their Lives and create a life without limits.

http://static1.squarespace.com/static/53af3954e4b093af3e17e0c3/t/55d67e22e4b0ea1246289b0f/1440120355481/?format=500w

Joe Koronowski's journey through life continues to inspire others to go where few go - to reach deep inside to uncover their true self. 

"Imagine living your daily life on a farm, surrounded by nature and being responsible for many lives such as cows, pigs, cats and even the occasional goat. Then years later you've worked hard and find yourself as one of NASA's top Flight Controllers operating the International Space Station!

BECAUSE of the many OBSTACLES put in my path I have learned, grown and become stronger.

Years later I was in Mission Control Houston; responsible for more lives, but this time the lives are very brave Astronauts. Here I was responsible for their lives in the event that a catastrophic failure happens in the living quarters of the International Space Station during my watch."

http://www.321launchyourlife.com/


https://youtu.be/99FBuO2eycQ?t=34

Joe’s life has followed a wandering path, which didn't include a vision of NASA. As a matter of fact, an early college career assessment test had Joe pegged as a Tug Boat Operator!

Born in upstate NY, he's the “middle boy” of six kids. His sister gave him this title because she was the only girl with five brothers.

Joe fell down the cellar stairs at the age of at two, earning him a few stitches. When he was nine years old, he accidentally set himself on fire with diesel fuel! Challenged by school, he failed second grade and was branded “math challenged” in high school. There, he was not only sentenced to remedial math classes, but also forced to quit his favorite sports of soccer and wrestling because he was bullied.

Joe’s high energy and love for physical activity fit well when he discovered bodybuilding. This not only increased his muscle mass, but was also the beginning of the long path to grow his self-esteem. Even though bodybuilding, coupled with his love for the outdoors, was a great outlet for his enormous passion and energy, these outlets alone couldn't satisfy his intellectual hunger. His restless curiosity was searching for something to grab onto, and college was a natural fit.

Through a suggestion from a co-worker, Joe went back to school to pursue his second degree, Engineering. Texas A&M was the beginning of a journey that, on the surface seemed to be bright, but was almost ending before it was to begin. Even though Joe had almost an insatiable curiosity to learn, college was not easy for him. After his first semester he was failing out! He was faced with a very important crossroad in life. Most of us give up when life seems to be heading in the wrong direction, Joe chose differently, he chose to stay in college and dig deep!

___________________________________________________

Every month, The New York  Power Team features a special guest speaker delivering content on a variety of topics of interest to high performers like you. Health and fitness, nutrition, finances, relationships, careers, overall mental well-being – we cover it all. Plus our outstanding peer group offers the support, encouragement – and accountability – to help you stay on course toward the life you want to lead. Make plans to join us at our next meeting and help spread the word to others who would benefit from the value we provide!

• Meeting dates are usually the 1st or 2nd Tuesday of each month -- or as announced when conflicts arise. 

• Please also be prepared with ideas and suggestions for the 2015 NYC Basket Brigade and the Westchester Basket Brigade.  We are an IRS registered 501(C)3 Not-For-Profit Corporation.  

Last year, we helped feed more than Thanks to your help, we expect to do even more this year!

Rest assured, we strive to give PowerTeam members an outstanding return on their investment of time and effort at every meeting. That means more social and volunteer activities. More personally relevant content. More skill and mastermind sessions. More goal setting. More support and accountability. If you know of a great presenter you'd like to recommend for an upcoming meeting, please let me know – we're always open to new guests who provide value.

NEO-ERICKSONIAN HYPNOSIS PRACTICE GROUP – Join us for our regular on-going Practice Group and become the best damn hypnotist you can be!

*Every second and forth Tuesday evening of the month. Continues October 13th and 27th for 2 hours, 7 PM to 9 PM at the TRS Suites in New York City.

Each meeting will focus on something new or in need of practice so we can improve our skills and expand our range. We’ll watch videos of Milton Erickson in action and take the time to dissect them and really learn from them. You’ll learn and share new techniques. We’ll swap scripts. We’ll swap books and other media. Above all, we’ll PRACTICE and get GOOD.

One benefit you get from attending is the group support of learning. Last time we met we watched a couple of hours of a newly available DVD set called “In the Room with Milton Erickson.” It’s how Erickson taught Ericksonian Hypnosis. Up to maybe a dozen people would squeeze into his office and listen to him speak and watch him do demos. Now YOU can be in that room too. It’s pretty amazing, really, and SO instructive. I love it.

AND – it’s only $20 a night! (Amazing deal.)

TUESDAY evening, October 13th and 27th

results.description:
There are new rules and <a>regulations</a> concerning the Tuesday <a>night</a> games. Please scroll down and read them all before signing up for the event.


There may not be space for you if you don't.


<a>Table</a> Top Role <a>Playing</a> Game Night!


This is the official <a>RPG game</a> night of the NY SciFi/Fan Meetup Group.

Every Tuesday night we get together to indulge in <a>Table Top RPGs</a>. There are <a>multiple games</a> going on at once, so getting involved in a game is <a>easy</a>.


For those of you unfamiliar with the term, a Table Top RPG (Role <a>Playing</a> Game) is a type of game where the players create characters based on the  story/system available and one person acts as a storyteller. Everyone interacts and works together to <a>create a story</a> and have a few laughs as well.


New Rules for Signing Up:


How to <a>sign up</a>: There will be at leas two <a>games running</a> each week.  You will be able to see who is running, what games are being <a>played</a>, and who is <a>playing</a> below. There will be a total of six spots <a>open</a> in each game, so if a game has filled up you will not be able to join that game. 


When you <a>sign up</a>, leave a comment stating which game you would like to participate in and your name will be added to the roster. If you would like to leave a game or switch over to another game in <a>progress</a>, simply speak to Justin or Cat. They will let you know if there is <a>open</a> space to do so.


If it is your first time <a>attending</a> a game, we have pre-made characters for you to <a>select</a> from. Beginning on your third RPG event, you may choose to make an original character for whatever game you're currently participating in.


Can I run my own game?: If you would like to run your own game, please contact Justin or Cat to reserve a slot.


Need Dice?: Please bring yours if you have some if you need extra I will provide some.

Current GMs

Justin

Cat


Steve

THIS EVENT IS NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOR MEMBERS OF ANY PARTICULAR PARTY, IT IS OPEN FOR ALL TO ENJOY. This is going to be an interesting evening!  Join us as we get to watch the first of the presidential candidates face off in the Democratic Candidate debates.  You will see the top 10 candidates square off with each other.  Arrive at 7pm for socializing and cocktails, grab a bite to eat then sit back and catch all the action on dozens of large monitors.

This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to kick off the political season. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear? Most people are coming from work so they will have on their work clothes, business casual

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
TOPIC


The Moon describes the emotional river running through all our lives, we are more at home and in the flow when we work with it rather than resist its deep current. When we really know the moon we were born under, the sign, aspects and phase of the moon, we have a new understanding of ourselves, what drives us, and what makes us feel at home. And we know the Moon of our partner, boss or best friend, we have a beneficial tool to understand and work with them.

SPEAKER

Heather Roan Robbins www.roanrobbins.com is a ceremonialist, spiritual counselor and astrologer with +30 years’ experience now practicing in MN.. Her active practice specializes in the astrology of relationship, to a beloved, to cohorts, family, self, and soul. she writes Starcodes, a weekly column by day not sign, for The Santa Fe New Mexican and websites, writes for WeMoon calendar, co-authors (with Anne Ortelee and Mark Wolz) the radio blog Access Astrology, and authored Moon Wisdom: Transform Your Life Using the Moon's Signs and Cycles from Cico Books, 2015.

A suggested donation is $5 very much appreciated. Please know whatever you can afford is acceptable.


Donations collected pay our rent, Meetup.com fees, beverages and snacks, and speaker! 

PS: If you show up a little early, the Quest Bookshop is an excellent source of many metaphysical books and items, and well worth a browse. They close at 7pm. 

DIRECTIONS & OUTLINE


The meetup takes place at the Theosophical Society, which is next door to Quest Bookshop. You may enter through the bookshop before 7 pm (when it closes) or to the left of the bookshop after 7 pm. A sign will be posted on the door you can enter. The following is a rough outline. The meetup will start at 7 pm SHARP.  NOTE: If you show up before 6:30pm we will make you help us set up the chairs!

7:00 - 7:20 - Short talk sharing some astrological fundamentals geared for absolute beginners 
7:20 - 7:40 - Brief intros from attendees, announcements 
7:40 - 9:00 - Main presentation 
9:00 - 9:15 - Socializing (while putting away chairs)
results.how_to_find_us: We are the door on the right (once you enter through the gate); look for the Meetup signs
results.name: October 2015: Working With Our Moon

results.description:
Tech Tuesday is Hack Manhattan’s weekly general interest open house. Don’t worry, it’s not just about technology—any kind of project is welcome.

Tech Tuesday is the perfect opportunity to visit Hack Manhattan and check out what it’s all about.

Bring a project and get to work, drink a homebrew beer, hang out, and draw on advice from our wonderful community.

If you want to join Hack Manhattan as a member, we expect you to have visited us at least twice before applying.

Find out more about Hack Manhattan at our website, hackmanhattan.com. Not everyone can come in every Tuesday, so most of the community happens on our mailing list.

Note: The last Tuesday of the month is our monthly business meeting. It usually lasts less than 30 minutes.

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time. 


If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on 72nd transverse at the point that overlooks Bethesda Fountain
results.name: Central Park Training Run

results.description:
Election 2016 Mood and Sentiment Analysis with Eric Tillberg - Eric developed an app that analyzes mood (via photos) and sentiment (via text) of political candidates based on tweets by major news outlets about the candidates. The example used in the talk will compare perceptions of Hillary Clinton to those of Donald Trump through five news outlets (CBS, CNN, Breitbart, Huffington Post, and Politico).

Your First Slack Bot in Ruby with Daniel Dubrovkine - A code-along of your first Slack Ruby bot and an overview of the Slack web and realtime APIs. Everyone is using Slack these days! Slack bots are fun and easy to make. 

Aging Software and Open Source with Jon Moss - The Ruby standard library and many of the Ruby boom gems (e.x. Rails, Rack, etc.) are beginning to age, and it's important that as open source users and maintainers that we take care of our critical infrastructure.
results.name: Sentiment Analysis and Slack Bots

results.description:
Pump it up!  The Gym is definitely back!  Great session earlier where we did a nice improv warm-up and then delved into a lot of Commercial cold reads.  I know I got some real insight into some of the highest paid work we actors can get.  Not too shabby and thank you to my colleagues at the Gym for the insight!  Spotting for each other is what the Gym is all about.   

Now for some upgrades and updates.  I was inspired by a fellow gym rat to put together a little handout for all the new and old members.  Here is what I and my friend were thinking:  We put a synopsis of some of the major acting schools format together.  So far I have read books by and taken classes on Chekov, Hagen, Stanislavski, Barrow and Boleslavsky.  Condensing each of them into some main points would be helpful I think so let me know if you would want something like that.  Also given the egalitarian ethos of the Gym if you have anything you would like added feel free to sent it to me or bring it to the Gym and we can see about putting it in so it can help everyone!  

While I am hesitant to put a rigid format on our freedom at the Gym I think a little warm-up with improv and then choices of Prepared scenes, monologues and then cold reads of monologues or commercials seems to be going great!   Can you think of a place where you get all of that for only a studio split of 5$?  I didnt think so.   Come and put in the work or just get a little taste of the art and play with a supportive and insightful bunch!

Looking forward to seeing everyone, chatting about projects and doing a lot of Working Out of those Acting Chops!
results.name: Pump, pump the jam, Again.

results.description:
The next ten to twenty years are going to hold some major breakthroughs in energy storage and efficiency. Many of these breakthroughs will be in the realm of democratized energy  - the ability to collect, store, and sell energy from your own private property. In addition, the IoT is going to bring more ubiquitous and sensitive sensors which can monitor and optimize our energy usage on a minute-by-minute basis.

The New Market For Energy

Solar power currently has the most direct connection to the idea of energy democratization, due to its low cost and relative material abundance. 

With the efficiencies of solar and other energy collection  and storage methods increasing, we're going to start seeing energy surpluses in private homes. The ability to sell that energy to your neighbors or to your city is going to become a reality very quickly.

Sensors and IoT

An increasing number of sensors and apps that measure our daily activities, from our exercise to our productivity, is going to begin to be applied to energy.

A smart energy grid will be able to route the right amount of energy, at the right price, at the right time, to your home. In addition to that, you'll begin to have more visibility over how much energy you're using and how to save money and save the environment through greater energy awareness.

This Think Tank

All of these breakthroughs are right around the corner, and it's up to the entrepreneur and researcher to push these breakthroughs to the larger markets.

At this Think Tank we'll begin to look at the current concept of a real smart energy grid. We'll brainstorm various applications of these grids, as well as the various types of systems and products that can be built ontop of them.

This will be a really in-depth discussion - lots to talk about on this topic! See you there.

-Dan

Special thanks to Breather for an awesome meeting room!

Exclusive Breather Benefit for XPRIZE Member Groups & Meetups 

The Think Tank is proud to partner with Breather for our amazing venue space!

Breather offers over 96 beautifully-designed private and productive office spaces throughout New York City, San Francisco and Boston, starting for as low as $15 an hour. Whether you're on-the-go meeting with clients and potential partners, need a space for a group meeting and a coffee shop won't do, Breather spaces are the perfect solution when you need a quiet place to work, meet, relax or recharge. 

As a special perk for being an XPRIZE member, you get 1 free hour to try Breather. Simply download the app and use the promo codeXPRIZE to try it out for free, or visit http://brt.hr/XPRIZE.

The New York Running company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has changing rooms, and free bag check also has lockers but you have to bring your own lock and closes at 9pm.

We can start off as a group and run as a group if everyone wants to run at the same pace but others are more than welcome to break up into smaller groups for those of you who might want to run a little faster.

After each run we head to our local bar DJ Reynolds to grab a drink or two and get something to eat and it gives us a chance to get to know each other.

You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
About the Artist:

As a child, Shoko Saida's father took her to see the Millet exhibition. There she saw "The Sower" and thought to want to be an artist. Currently, she produces her works while working on a mass-media related job. Her works are created on the theme on people. Since she lives in japan, She draws settings in Japan. She thinks to draw not only fun and heartwarming works but also people in various scenes.

Under the aging society in Japan, there are many social problems such as child abuse, irregular employment, and an increase in poor people receiving livelihood protections. Including such things, she thinks she will continue drawing with the theme of people.

Her works are drawn from both real experiences and imaginations. She thinks she could send cries through drawings to the generations to live a future. She would like the visitors of her solo exhibition to experience not only one emotion but their own feelings.

In addition to her works, as an artist she started a project to distribute sketchbooks to children living in child welfare facilities, homeless people, and impoverished people, with the hope that expressing themselves will enrich their minds. She produces her own works while proceeding with this project.

Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: Codesters (http://blog.codesters.com/)


Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!

*NEW LOCATION*

IMPROV FOR ACTORS - LET'S GET PHYSICAL


This Improv for Actors workshopwill focus on using your body to express yourself more freely and authentically. We will also work on connecting the mind and the body so that you can perform wholly and not just from the neck up.


A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.

THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV


Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.

Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.

DESCRIPTION by the Brooklyn Historical Society:

"Joseph Alexiou's forthcoming book, Gowanus: Brooklyn's Curious Canal, narrates more than three hundred years in the history of our borough's most compelling former industrial waterway. From idyllic oyster beds to dumping grounds for toxic waste, Gowanus is intrinsically linked to Brooklyn's industrial and agricultural past. In celebration of his book’s release, Alexiou will discuss the parallels in today's Gowanus real estate rush with that of the 1860s, which coincided with Brooklyn's rapid industrial transformation."

$5 for members of the BHS, $10 for non-members. (Charged by the BHS, not the meetup organizers)
